185001.name: Tintin Joker
boardgamefamily: Card Games: Draw and Discard Games
185001.description:
The game is comprised of seven sets of nine cards. Each set of the same colour includes five positive point cards (10 through 50), three negative point cards (-10 through -30) and one wild card (the joker). Each set contains images taken from a Tintin book (Coke en Stock, Le Crabe aux pinces d’or, Tintin au pays de l’or noir, Le Sceptre d’Ottokar, Le Secret de La Licorne, Le Temple du Soleil, and Tintin au Tibet).

'Tintin Joker' is a simple Rummy variant. The goal—collecting sets with as many positive points as one can at the end of each game while giving the maximum number of negative cards to your opponents. The first player to go out achieves a bonus.

185002.name: Sum
185002.description:
User summary:

Sum is a generic, universal rule system that has no associated genre or setting. The rules are simple and easy to use. All characters have narrative tags that are descriptive and drive character motivation and goals. Atypically, these narrative tags also have a value associated with them to indicate how "strong" the narrative tag is. Characters also have Abilities which collapse all traits into a single category (e.g., there are not Attributes and Skills in this system--there is only the single category of Abilities). Abilities have scores ranging from -5 to +5.

The core action resolution system involves establishing a target difficulty and subtracting that from the character's ability level. Then 2d6 are rolled, but one is treated as positive and one is treated as negative (that is, one helps and one hinders). These dice are summed to the previous value with negative results indicating failure and positive results or zero indicating success. The system supports varying degrees of success or failure. Opposed actions are similar except the opponent's ability and roll are contrasted to the actor's ability and roll instead of a target difficulty. The rules support a group action resolution method, as well, which is quite interesting.

185003.name: Minions: A Collaborative Roleplaying Game
185003.description:
User summary:

Minions is quite unique - it can be played standalone, in which case it forms a sort of narrative storytelling system, or it can be "bolted on" to any other generic rules mechanics and played as a sort of setting-cum-scenario. The rules mention FUDGE as being especially suitable for mechanics.

Minions is set in an urban area--time-period irrelevant. Thus, a medieval fantasy city, a modern metropolis, or a futuristic space station would all work fine. There just have to be a lot of people concentrated in one place. The game involves generating thirty-two characters very quickly, so obviously FUDGE or similar systems with very streamlined mechanics are highly preferable to other rules-heavy systems. These characters are more like "non-player characters" in traditional RPGs than typical "characters"--they may (and do) change players during the game.

The game is played by attempting to weave together the narratives of multiple characters so they become inextricably involved in a single "faction" which forms a support base for the urban area operations. Atypically, the roleplaying game results in a winner when one player assembles the largest faction and all characters are aligned with a faction.

The rules of minion deal with characters, characterization (brief), and changing loyalties and how this occurs. These rules may stand alone or, as mentioned, by integrated with any other universal mechanics.

185004.name: Bolognabalogical Science
185004.description:
The concept: Players compete for associate, bachelor's, master's and, finally, doctoral degrees in Bolognabalogical Science by advancing the pawns around a game board depicting the campus of Baloney State University. Each "student" rolls a die to collect vowels and consonants to make up a word with a nonsensical definition. Pawns are advanced by the forming of nonsense words with nonsense definitions from two sets of drawing cards-one for vowels, one for consonants (example: "hinduey: The saggy seat of a loosely worn pair of denim trousers"). Once a player's opponents have accepted a nonsense word and its definition, the player moves his game pawn one space for every letter in the word. Wild-card "Report Cards" add an element of chance (example: "You were caught engaging in the latest campus fad-mud puddle mopping-Report to the Dean`s Office-Don`t Roll!")

The game comes with a board, pawns and die, plus a Baloney State University Student Handbook and a student newspaper, Tall Tales. The handbook provides photographs of the mock school's faculty. Sal Monilla is the cafeteria chef.

185005.name: El desafío del dragón
185005.description:
El desafío del dragón is a game where you have to travel a dungeon with the danger of being pushed by the dragon into the abyss.
Will you arrive at your castle before the others?
Using a spinner, you have to move your knight to your tower.

Spanish description:
Un juego en el que tendrás que recorrer una mazmorra con el peligro de ser empujado por el dragón al abismo ¿Lograrás llegar a tu castillo antes que el resto? Estamos ante un juego mecánico en el que mediante una ruleta tendremos que hacer llegar a la torre a nuestro caballero.

185007.name: The Demons of Austerlitz
185007.description:
From the Introduction:

1806 The Treaty of Pressburg was a disaster, but no one was aware of how much of a disaster. Things were kept away from our reality by the presence of the Holy Roman Empire; many of the lives lost that were instrumental in keeping the world hidden. There are things of darkness, madness and evil, which feasted on suffering, pain, and the Emperor Napoleon, brought many of these with him. The blood shed at Austerlitz lit the fuse to blow open the portals to our world.

The Ritual
For centuries, certain priests of the Holy Roman Empire performed a daily ritual to keep our lands safe. However, an errant artillery shell killed them in the middle of this ritual. The sudden brutality of their deaths left it impossible to pass this knowledge on. A week after the death of these priests, the first cracks in the veil begin to manifest.

1808 Austerlitz becomes a nightmare land, those living in the area change. Malformed, demonic shapes, the dead rise to walk once more, other creatures not of our world spew forth in more terrifying forms, the lands became despoiled and changing. This was only the first, they engaged Napoleons armies in battle, and few survived. The sky burned and entire battle groups disappeared in these hellish lands. Many cities of the once great Holy Roman Empire are quickly swallowed up by the blight.

1809 Emperor Napoleon set aside pride and allied with other powers to drive these demonic forces away. However, many of these factions blamed Napoleon for the current state of affairs. They are not far wrong. Nevertheless, they attacked…and failed. The demon armies grow in strength

1810 You are a member of one of the mockingly self-named Hell Companies. The world has gone mad... and you need to survive, and stay sane. Face to face with demons will test your will and your courage, but first you must reach Rome, find the library at the Quirinal Palace, and locate the tomes needed to seal the rifts. Many have tried, none have returned.

185008.name: Sinless RPG
185008.description:
From the Introduction:

Sinless rpg is a role playing game about world rulers trying to clear their consciences by dealing with world crises. They command countries with their own armies, facilities and resources.

185009.name: Creators of the Universe
185009.description:
From the Introduction:

Creators of the Universe is a roleplaying game about the creation of a fantasy world, featuring interplayer conflict. This game is somewhat different than other RPGs, in that the players are encouraged to destroy, scheme, betray, and steal from each other. For in Creators of the Universe, the players are not allies, but divine beings, seeking to mold the world in their image.

185010.name: Not Afraid...
185010.description:
From the Introduction:

A 4-6 player game about escaping after a night in Maledict Manor. The Manor has a long history of blood, betrayal and suffering and is thought to be under the influence of dark magics. Legends say that those who spend a night in the Manor will be possessed by spirits seeking to free themselves of the cursed place.

185011.name: Who's Dinner
185011.description:
From the Introduction:

A quick 4-6 player game about not being the one who is eaten. You play as kobolds bringing offerings to the hungry Great Dragon... along with some good reasons why you shouldn't be eaten, and another of your fellows should be.

185012.name: Seasons Change
185012.description:
From the Introduction:

A 4-6 player game about the journey of enlightenment, adventure, and the spirits of the seasons that judge those seeking their approval.

185013.name: Taglar's Tomb
185013.description:
From the front cover:

An old plundered tomb where many a grave-robber got their start... ...now it’s your turn to spend the night.

185014.name: Uno: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
185014.description: Get ready to unleash your turtle power in this Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle (TMNT) version of UNO, dudes! Classic UNO rules apply, yet with the addition of a special rule and four corresponding action cards, players get the chance to experience all new game changing moments! This fearsome foursome of turtles works together with the Team Attack Card, which allows players to vanquish three villains from their hand! Fans of the cartoon series and movie will recognize their favorite characters, like Leonardo and Michelangelo, who are featured on the cards they play. And do not forget to yell "UNO" when you have but one card remaining!

185015.name: Coin Magic
185015.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cash In on the Mysterious Magic of Currency!

Coins have a special sort of magic all their own. They are the scales by which the value of all things are measured, and yet they, themselves, have value only because society accepts that they do. The images and words stamped on coins can tell us a great deal about where and when they came from, and they capture and preserve the images of kings, sages, and other great figures, who might otherwise have been lost to the mists of time. They are a convenient window into the realms of the fates, as all can hinge on the flip of a coin. Perhaps most important of all, they are everywhere, and they are something that common man and adventurer alike often take for granted.

This book mints 15 brand new spells that explore these magical aspects of coins, and others. From simple and common cantrips to powerful 9th-level spells, no magic is too small or too great for the magnificent coin. Inside this book you will find:

Powerful traps that can be laid on a coin, which can do great harm to anyone that has the coin in her possession.
A spell that allows you to preserve your spirit within a coin, providing a potential reprieve from death.
A spell that allows you to gamble great amounts of magical power on a single coin flip.




...and much more!

185016.name: Festival of Fear (Supers!)
185016.description:
From publisher blurb:

The villainous clown, Big Top, has kidnapped a busload of orphans to be raised as brainwashed minions! Can the heroes unravel the mysterious disappearance in time to save the children from becoming villains’ pawns?

185017.name: Festival of Fear (Savage Worlds)
185017.description:
From publisher blurb:

The villainous clown, Big Top, has kidnapped a busload of orphans to be raised as brainwashed minions! Can the heroes unravel the mysterious disappearance in time to save the children from becoming villains’ pawns?

Festival of Fear is for use with Savage Worlds Super Powers Companion (2nd Ed)

185018.name: Atlas of the French Arm
185018.description:
From publisher blurb:

The French Arm is the most heavily-settled branch of human exploration and expansion, running from Earth though the link at Wolf 359 and extending all the way up to the Wolf Cluster and Kaefer space, with the colony world of Aurore being the furthest, and most recent, permanent settlement.

The Atlas of the French Arm coves all the worlds and colonies within this immense region of space, including the history of its exploration, the wars that have erupted along its length, and the new dangers that are just beginning to be uncovered at its furthest, darkest reaches.

The perfect companion to French Arm Adventures, Atlas of the French Arm is a complete campaign setting for 2300AD that provides enough material to keep players and referees going for months.

185019.name: Lord Leohn
185019.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Argo Galaxy is growing – not physically but figuratively. After years of study, the House of the Alliance has finally decided to open the Hastilion Expanse for full settlement and corporate utilization. Researchers identified numerous planets and moons as optimal for civilization and corporations from around the known galaxy, including Drake Mining and Manufacturing, are making plans to acquire land.

Since its inception, Drake Mining and Manufacturing has prided itself on mining resources and creating high-quality products from those resources to support the entire galaxy. Moving into the Hastilion Expanse provides them with a wealth of opportunities to expand their operations and grow their business. That is, of course, if their new facilities can survive.

New planets are always fraught with hidden dangers from native flora and fauna, pirates, rival corporations, and rebellious populations. Only the strength of Drake’s mercenary force will help them overcome any roadblocks and become successful. As long as they don’t get killed in the process.

Lord Leohn presents the Novice portion of the Hastilion Expanse campaign for Mercenary Breed Savage Worlds or it can be used as a collection of adventures for any sci-fi setting. Originally published in Savage Insider Premium and the Hastilion Expanse Compendiums, this new campaign book updates the content to Mercenary Breed 2.0 and expands on the original content.

Lord Leohn includes:

Novice-rank campaign missions.
A collection of additional Novice-rank adventures based within the Drake Mining and Manufacturing setting.
New Xenopedia entries.

185020.name: The Lost Halls of Hightamrish
185020.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Halls of Hightamrish once echoed with laughter and conversation. Deep in the strong walls, the inhabitants were wealthy, powerful and safe. Or so they thought. It began when a guard developed a fever, and, despite the best efforts of the healers, passed away. But before he could be buried he returned to life, and attacked others in the stronghold. Panic set in, and people flocked away, taking anything of value, even though the undead had been destroyed. The Halls were never used again, and over time fell from memory. Some say the halls and corridors still echo with laughter - or shriek with the cries of the restless dead..

Need a quick map for an encounter?

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depicting a dungeon built into stone. A large pillared hall with decorative flooring connects to corridors, smaller rooms and other areas. The Halls have been abandoned - anything of value; chests, tables, furniture; have all be taken or long since rotted away.

185021.name: Liguria
185021.description:
Description from the publisher:

In Liguria, players take the role of merchants who sail the Ligurian Sea to discover beautiful and exotic colors. By trading, conquering and engaging in diplomatic relationships, they can earn valuable prestige points. Fulfilling contracts with the bishop can prove very lucrative...

Make sure to collect all special colors in the various harbors and bring them back home to make your cathedral stand out the most.

Liguria is a prequel to the award-winning game Fresco. As a standalone game, it tells the story of how the colors came to the markets of the Ligurian cities to paint the beautiful frescos.

185022.description:
Promo card handed out at Essen in 2006.
When played, all crosshairs are removed from the play area.
185022.name: Sitting Ducks Gallery: Ein bisschen Frieden

185023.name: Spooky's House of Jump Scares
185023.description:
Can you survive 1000 rooms of cute terror? Or will you break once the cuteness starts to fade off and your running for your life from the unspeakable hideous beings that shake and writhe in bowels of this house? They wait for you, they wait and hunger for meeting you. They long to finally meet you and show you how flexible your skin can be after it has soaked in blood. Will you brave this journey, will you set to beat the impossible, the insane, and the incorporeal?

Source: The Developer Website.

185024.name: Fruit Mix
185024.description: Do you find it hard to play memory games where you have to find two tiles or cards that match? Good news! Fruit Mix is an exceptional "anti-memory" game: the goal is to find two tiles that do not match! The images have three distinct characteristics so this game requires you to apply not only your memory, but logic as well. To memorize the whole card? Or only some of the characteristics? Maybe it's better to just remember the missing characteristics? Choosing your tactics is the key to success! Get energized with this bold and brainy game!

185025.name: Fantasy Calvinball
185025.description:
From the Introduction:

In the beginning, underneath Heaven, there was Nothing. Nothing happened because nothing had to happen; and there was nothing there to stop it, of course. Entropy ruled the void, reining on a throne of illogic.

The Old Ones, finding the world full of nothingness, created Causes. Causes demanded Effect. And thus, the age of Nil became the age of Chaos, the world turning into a primordial ooze of senseless Happenings, an endless howling of insanity. And thus was the universe created.

The Titans, finding the world full of madness, created Justifications. Only Effects could create Causes, but Causes could create Effects. Slowly, the howling void of the age of Chaos became the age of Order, each Titan carving out a Plane to call their Own. And thus were the planes created.

The Sage Kings, finding the world torn asunder into competing kingdom ringed by realms of chaos, sought to unify the Causes - fire and water, air and earth, metal and wood, light and dark, holy and profane, emotion and logic. So did the Sage Kings between them craft the System, which unified the competing Causes into one System of checks and balances, reason and design, merit and necessity, an age of Laws. And thus was the world created.

In crafting the world, just like the forces before them, the Sage Kings sowed their own destruction. In creating the System, they created peoples to enact its laws: human and elf, goblin and troll, orc and fairy, each of the countless races made in the image of their Sage. People who question if the System is not a unification of the causes. merely another Cause whose Effect is simple self-perpetuation, who chafe under an unjust Heaven - but the System, being created by the combined effort of the Sage-Kings, is greater than the Sage-Kings, greater than the Titans, perhaps even greater than the Old Ones themselves. It is the cusp of a new age led by the Folk, where the races created by the Sages take up the mantle of Heaven and direct the System with their own hands.

But even if it is the time for the children of the Sage Kings to take the mantle of Heaven, none know what Age is going to come to pass...

185027.name: The Evil
185027.description:
User summary:

The Evil - A Short Horror RPG attempts to create a cinematic roleplaying experience where characters represent the archetypes found in horror movies, doing the stupid (and often fatal) things that horror movie characters do.

Character creation is relatively simple. Players select an Archetype (preferably from a horror movie) to model their character upon. Characters then receive Traits which are narrative tags describing anything notable about the character--usually 5-10 Traits are selected. Traits are given a numeric score of 1-20, optionally as high as 30 or even 40 with GM consent.

Action resolution is based upon traits and difficulty. Really Easy tasks are rated at +10, Hard at -10, and Impossible at -20. These modifiers are added to the relevant Trait and then 1d20 must score under the result for success. Attempting an action without a relevant trait uses a separate table.

185028.name: Giraffometer
185028.description: Have you ever tried to compare the speed of a raindrop with the weight of the world's largest pumpkin or the number of rooms in Buckingham Palace? In the fast-paced trivia game Giraffometer, you don't need to know the right answer! In the world of amazing, astonishing and just plain funny facts that awaits you, just try to correctly guess which facts have the highest and lowest numbers! And may your Giraffometer never fail you!

185031.name: Evolution: Dare to be God
185031.description:
User summary:

In Evolution - Dare to be God the characters are Gods who administer an "Eden", or paradise. Characters have a "Possibility Rating" of 13. Each player begins with fifty humans which are "blank slates" (in game terms, these are the characters' resources). The game is played in turns called Generations (about 32 years) and follows a structured path.

In play, each character must roll 4d6 against their Possibility Rating to effect change in their population, rolling low indicates success. Characters attempt to advance their population in numbers, technology, learning, and power. Eventually, the population must leave the "Eden" at which point they will encounter the populations of other characters. Conflict ensues.

185032.name: Throne of Elements
185032.description:
In Throne of Elements, you command one of four playful golem tribes. Your goal is to make your tribe dominate the region by sending in more golems to the region. You can win by controlling more than half of the region or wait until end of the competition and see who is left standing.

Throne of Elements is a secret objective card game where you control a certain group of golems and deploy them to wrest control over a small area. When simply deploying your golems is not enough, powerful action cards can be used to relocate other golems or remove them from the competition!

Throne of Elements is fun to play with family and friends. It's easy for children to learn and can be challenging for advanced group of player. Throne of Elements also comes in a compact size, making it easy to carry around in your pocket.

185033.name: Gossamer Options: Characters
185033.description:
From publisher blurb:

Infinite Worlds means Infinite Options.

Gossamer Options: Characters is a different kind of supplement for Lords of Gossamer & Shadow. Originally created as a set of fan blog posts by designer Mark Knights, about 30 character builds presented at three different point levels (Low, Medium, and High), providing you with over 90 ready to use statblocks. This variant character builds of different power level make them useful to players and GMs at all levels of play. This product can function as both a collection of pregenerated characters for players and as a toolbox of NPCs for GMs. Rite Publishing is happy to be able to present them here as a 72 page full-color Print and PDF product.

185034.name: Sicarius: Base Role Playing System
185034.description:
User summary:

Sicarius - Base Role Playing System is a complex, generic, universal system that provides a fusion of class and skill based gaming. The game is played with d10s but has an alternate mechanism using a pack of playing cards. When percentile dice are rolled they can "explode" into "Infinite Dice" on particularly good rolls. The GM is called the Arbiter; the other players run Characters. Characters have a selected Class and then use a point pool to purchase Skills (Skill costs vary by Class/Skill combination). Characters also have nine Primary Stats (Might, Endurance, Agility, Dexterity, Intelligence, Resolve, Spirit, Personality, and Luck) and several other possible Stats such as Tech Level. Characters have additional statistics that vary during game play such as Life, Power, Quickness, and Fatigue. A variety of other performance abilities are mathematically derived from, generally, Primary Stats (for example, Social, Occult, Control, and Sensitivity).

Skill attempts are resolved by rolling under a Difficulty Factor established by the GM. Other types of rolls made in the game include Primary Stat rolls, Luck rolls, and so forth. Skill levels increase through use and training; increases are more likely for characters with high intelligence. Because most game actions are based on Skills, characters with low intelligence rapidly will stall out in ability relative to characters with high intelligence.

The system uses a quite complex combat methodology with Combat Turns broken into Combat Pulses. Characters use a variety of inputs to determine their Action Pulse value which is referenced on a chart to determine which Combat Pulse(s) they may act upon. This is modified by a variety of situational values called Quickness Modifiers. Combat supports a variety of special actions such as parry or natural (non-weapon) attacks. Weapons supported range from clubs to heavy artillery to pulse cannon. Armors appear in several types--some decrease hit chance, others absorb damage, and still others do both. A Fatigue system is used which influences Skill performance and Combat performance. Damage sustained also influences various performance metrics.

185035.name: Equipment Tricks for Lanterns
185035.description:
From publisher blurb:

With a wealth of feat options at a player’s disposal, it can be difficult to find something new to define your character. The Equipment Trick feat introduced new ways to specialize around the gear you use the most, differentiating your character from every other rank-and-file warrior. With Sidebar: Equipment Tricks for Lanterns, you’ll find a dozen exciting new ways to employ this simple tool in your game, both in and out of combat. Being the lantern-bearer won’t be just a chore anymore!

185036.name: Grand Tome of Adversaries (Second Edition)
185036.description:
From publisher blurb:

As the ancient Seal of Solomon has slowly faded over millennia, more denizens of the Invisible World slip once again into the world of man. Only the gifted ranks of Witch Hunters, amazing mortals that stand against the forces of the Adversary, are equipped to face terrors beyond human understanding.

This invaluable guide to the fearsome monsters of the Invisible World provides everything needed by the Grand Masters to challenge cadres of intrepid Witch Hunters with the foulest minions of the Adversary.

185037.name: Random Collection 1
185037.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spells and the supernatural are a staple part of many games and settings. They allow the user to bend reality to their will or to bring down their wrath on their enemies.

This volume in the Superlative Spells series covers a random collection of spells created initially with a randomised generated.

The spells you'll find in this volume:

Binding Treaty - Force two or more people to abide to a truce/treaty for a short period of time.
Disgusting Vitality - Gain health from a disgusting act
Elemental Body - Take on appearance and minor effect from one of the 4 main elements.
Energetic Winged Shield - A shield that can move fast to protect its user.
Exponential Blood-letting - Starts off small, but causes more bleeding as time goes on.
Heroes Acceleration - Moves the caster/target fast to defend a loved one or ally from an attack.
Lunar Disgust - Makes lycanthropes find you disgusting, making it difficult to attack you.
Slaying Poetry - Can injure enemies or at least stun them with the sheer power of your poetry.
Symbiotic Bolas - A whirling attacking conjured weapon that does more damage the healthier the caster is.
Wizards Pike - Summons a magical pike in front of the spell caster.

185038.name: Fable: A Free, Universal Role-playing System
rpg: Fable: A Free, Universal Role-playing System
185038.description:
User summary:

Fable - A Free, Universal Role-playing System is distributed as a single MS Word .DOC file. It is usable by neophyte players and includes an excellent and concise introduction to roleplaying methods.

Characters have Traits which are narrative tags describing their abilities--Characters typically will have two to ten Traits, usually about Five. Each Trait has an associated Level which determines the type of die the player will use when that Trait is utilized, from d4 to d20, but typically in the d6 to d10 range. Characters also have Karma Points that may be spent during play to alter outcomes.

Unopposed actions have a Difficulty assigned by the GM and characters must roll over the Difficulty to succeed. Opposed Actions (including combat) use a Trait vs. Trait approach but otherwise work the same way. Wounds occur in nine stages, from "Just a Scratch" to "Mortal Blow".

185039.name: Fables Light
185039.description:
User summary:

Fables Light is an almost entirely narrative roleplaying game. A typical game has one to five characters, called Protagonists, and a Director (or GM) that establishes the setting, plays the Antagonists (non-player characters), and resolves any issues that cannot be resolved through collaborative narration. Additionally, the Director is responsible for taking notes and compiling a post-game summary.

The game is concerned with recreating exciting scenes, linked together by narrative arcs to create a campaign. Characters are defined as players see fit, but generally follow a description with personality elements and traits. They grow and change as the game progresses. The rules essentially deal with methods to streamline activity and provide for speedy, exciting play.

185040.name: Samara: Expansion 2 – Winter & Summer Tiles
185040.description:
Samara: Expansion 2 – Winter & Summer Tiles consists of three tiles, each with a winter and a summer side. Each tile has the same shape as the time track tiles, but is only one, two or three months wide.

One winter and one summer tile side (randomly determined) become part of the timetrack, with the winter tile placed between December and January and the summer tile between June and July. These tiles limit the options in winter and in summertime, and in the winter work is harder (more strength needed) while during the summer lighter (less strength needed).

185041.description:
Empires: Age of Discovery - World Variant Components contains the components necessary to play the World variant side of the Age of Discovery Board.

Components Included

17 Trade Goods (4 Types)
10 Capital Buildings:




Around the Cape - Age I
Trade Routes To Asia - Age I
Alliance - Age I
Garrisons - Age I
Fleet of Discovery - Age II
Goa - Age II
Zanzibar - Age II
European War - Age III
Cardinal Richelieu - Age III
Cathedrals - Age III
185041.name: Empires: Age of Discovery – World Variant Components

185042.name: NHL 16
videogamehonor: 2015 Game Critics Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
185042.description:
Built with more input from our fans than ever before, NHL 16 steps onto the ice to deliver ways to compete as a team, new features across the most played single-player modes, gameplay innovation at every position on the ice and an unrivalled game day atmosphere.

NEW WAYS TO COMPETE AS A TEAM
Hockey is a sport that comes to life in a competitive team-based gameplay experience. Whether it’s through speed, skill, or physicality, every player makes an impact on the ice no matter what position they play or their role on the team. So grab some friends and jump into either 6 v. 6 Online Team Play, Online Couch Co-op, or the re-imagined EA SPORTS Hockey League and prove that great individuals can’t beat a great team.

A WAY TO PLAY FOR EVERY HOCKEY FAN
Whether you’re an armchair GM, want to live out your NHL pro fantasy, or build your ultimate dream team, NHL 16 will deliver a single-player game mode for every type of hockey fan - each with new features that you’ve never seen in EA SPORTS NHL.

Source: The Publisher Website.

185043.name: Pixel Puzzles 2: Anime
185043.description:
Pixel Puzzles 2: Anime is a traditional style jigsaw puzzle game, featuring 25 hand drawn images in a Kawaii style, with each puzzle piece uniquely shaped in a way no physical puzzle could be.

Use Pixel Pixie's dust powers to help solve puzzles. Ghosts, rotations, locations - the pixel pixie can help with it all, because no pixel puzzling anime experience would be complete without a fairy addicted to dust!

Features:

25 puzzles in a range of sizes from 60 to 350 pieces.
Auto saving, never lose your progress.
Chearful kawaii atmosphere.
Traditional puzzle gameplay.
27 Steam Achievements.
Puzzle piece rotation.
Interactive play environment.
Awesome hand draw anime artwork.
Power ups to help solve puzzles.

Source: The Developer Website.

185044.description:
Age of Discovery - Bonus Capital Buildings includes four new Capital Buildings:

Conquest of the Aztec Empire - - Age I
Spice Trade - Age II
Colony in India - Age III
Independence - Age III
185044.name: Empires: Age of Discovery – Bonus Capital Buildings

185045.name: Pixel Puzzles 2: Birds
185045.description:
Featuring some truly fowl images indeed. Pixel Puzzles 2: Birds is a traditional style jigsaw puzzle game, with crabs scurrying around so WATCH YOUR FINGERS!!!

So, what to do about those pesky crabs? Rather than giving them a squish, throw them in a cage. Collect and consume your little shelled friends to gain special puzzle solving abilities, with the crab grabbing power up system. Go catch them critters, they’re hiding under the pieces!

Features:

27 puzzles in a range of sizes from 60 to 350 pieces.
Auto saving, never lose your progress.
Relaxing atmosphere.
Traditional puzzle gameplay.
26 Steam Achievements.
Puzzle piece rotation.
Beautiful photos of birds, taken in the south atlantic.
Interactive play environment.
Power ups to help solve puzzles.

Source: The Developer Website.

185046.name: The Fallen Barony
185046.description:
User summary:

The Fallen Barony was published by a manufacturer of a line of weapons, armors, and equipment for Live-Action Role-Playing. As such, the game has a fairly heavy emphasis on arms, armor, and equipment.

Characters belong to a House, have 10 Health Points and, if of the Elfkin race, have 10 Energy Points. Characters select a class from a list of two: Shadowmages or Lightmages. Characters may being play with whatever equipment they carry (with some restrictions based on Rank). Characters begin with two Skills, each at Level 1 (Skill Levels range from 1-5). Characters also may cast spells (called Shards). Characters gain one Experience Point for each event they attend and may spend these Experience Points to gain new Skills or Shards, or to improve a current Skill.

The rules document explains the various Houses and their structure and function within the game, and has a lengthy section on setting, history, and society. Several types of weapon also are noted.

Although the rules are not credited to any person or persons, they do state they are based "...on the Novel of Mark Harm."

185047.name: Drip Drop
185047.description:
Patience and accuracy are needed in a game relative of darts but using water. With a water proof board at your feet, players aim for targets on the board with dippers in hand.
Their are positive, negative, and card spots.
Using a round setting, set the round maximum. Getting 3 drops per round, aim and call out which target you're attempting to hit. The objective is to gain the most positive points at the end of the round. Negatives decrease your points and the card will make you draw, giving you directions on how to drip your next drop. Maybe closing your eyes or dripping behind your back has a benefit? The card has many ways to Drip

185048.name: CardArt
185048.description:
Description from the publisher:

With as few cards as possible, try to portray a concept while everyone else tries to guess what it is. Whoever gets it first by calling it out receives points, as does the player who successfully portrayed it.

In more detail, in CardArt the players can use the cards as they like: laying them flat on the table, keep them in upright position, or any position they think are helpful to get the concept across to the table to the other players. You can even move them on the table and in the air. With the person card Luca, for example, it is easier to portray a racecar driver in his car or a parachuter under a slightly bended card. The only limits are with the imagination of the players...

185049.name: Deadzone: Second Wave Card Deck
185049.description:
This deck enables you to field all second wave miniatures for Deadzone, including Asterians, Forge Fathers and new models for the Enforcers, Plague, Marauders and Rebs. Also includes cards for all mercenary releases to date.

Each card contains the necessary unit stats, abilities, weapons and equipment in order to field it in your game.

This set contains cards for:

All existing mercenaries, including The Helfather, Wrath and Recon Unit N32-19
Upcoming named characters, including Bjarn Starnafall, Sergeant Howlett and Eddak P’mera.
Enforcer Reinforcements, including Enforcer Peacekeepers, Enforcer Pathfinder, Enforcer Pathfinder on bike and Recon Drone
Vehicles, including GR77 Strider, Plague GR77 Strider, Rebs GR75 Strider, Marauder Stuntbot and Forge Father Iron Ancestor.
Plague Stage 3Z (zombies!)
DreadBall Strider, Jack and Guard for the special MVP scenario in Nexus Psi.

185050.description:
Description from the publisher:

One player turns over all the cards as quickly as he can. At the same time, the other players collect as many complete animals (that consist of three parts each) as they can in the given time.

But since the time pressure is high in Nimmit and the parts of the animals look quite similar, players can easily mess it up.
185050.name: Nimmit

185051.name: All Guns On Deck
185051.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




The vast horizons are full of pirates, vagabonds with no claim to the ground their feet tread. Amongst the bandits scattered across the oceans, four factions dominate the worlds main landmasses. Eutopia’s conquest will be the force that rids the world of its calamity. Making way for a new era of prosperity, with all continents under one banner.

In a world where sea battles are the punch line of jokes uttered by historians, the generals of Eutopia focus their efforts on reviving the lost art of ship building to aid in the campaign against aerially superior foes. Hiring small bands of mercenaries to take to the seas and launch a global attack on all fronts from beneath the skies. Though, as men once again set sail, the ocean reminds why the depths were abandoned all those years ago.

Source: The Developer Website.

185053.description: First Player marker with wooden holder to keep it upright. Dimension: 120 mm x 75 mm
185053.name: River Dragons: First Player Marker

boardgameintegration: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Modern Era Core Rules
Lock 'n Load Tactical: Modern Era Core Rules
185057.description:
Heroes Against the Red Star is a complete Lock ‘n Load core game which brings the Lock ‘n Load Tactical system to West Germany to Paris , on the first days of World War III.

You’ll command a bucket of 1985-era weaponry including Soviet T-80, T-72, T-64, and T-55 tanks Hind helicopters, Soviet infantry, paratroopers, BMPs, and all their accoutrements of war - RPGs, RPKs, RPDs, you are free to do so. You also forces representing French conscripts, the Foreign Legion, Paratroopers, and lots of tanks. You’ll match AMX30 B-2 tanks against the best Russian armor, direct Jaguar airstrikes, and recon enemy positions with ERC-90 and AMX 10RC armored cars

You get to play with anti-tank guided missiles (ATGM), which are easily depleted, advanced armor, advanced sights (thermal and night), fixed wing air support, and much more.

Fight scenarios from the first probes by Soviet infantry to the ultimate, desperate clash for the Eisenbach Bridge. This is modern street fighting., in the buildings, on the deck of the tanks.
185057.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes Against the Red Star
boardgamepodcastepisode: GrogCast Season 2, Episode 7

185060.description:
From the publisher:

“You should have taken the realm for yourself. It was there for the taking. Jaime told me how you found him on the Iron Throne the day King's Landing fell, and made him yield it up. That was your moment. All you needed to do was climb those steps, and sit. Such a sad mistake.”
–George R.R. Martin, A Game of Thrones

In the aftermath of the Tourney for the Hand, Eddard Stark searches for answers to the questions posed by Jon Arryn’s death. Across the Narrow Sea, Daenerys Targaryen rides across the Dothraki sea to Vaes Dothrak with a massive khalasar and her husband, Khal Drogo. The Great Houses stir restlessly across Westeros, watching and plotting their own bids for power. From the sands of Dorne to the icy forests beyond the Wall, tension grows with every passing day.

Enter the unrest and intrigue of A Game of Thrones: The Card Game with No Middle Ground, the fourth Chapter Pack in the Westeros cycle! Like the other packs of this cycle, No Middle Ground follows the events of the first book in A Song of Ice and Fire, introducing iconic characters like Hodor and Gendry to the game for the first time. In addition, you’ll find five new plots in this Chapter Pack—three faction-specific and two neutral—that vastly increase your options for building any faction’s plot deck.
185060.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition) – No Middle Ground
boardgamefamily: A Song of Ice and Fire
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Good The Board and The Joe Likes Space Alert Way Too Much: Episode 77 “Programming Games”

185061.name: FaLoR: Fast and Loose Role-Playing
185061.description:
User summary:

FaLoR is a generic, universal system with an extremely simple set of rules. Characters are said to have "Characteristics" that include whatever categories are needed for play, and examples include "Strong" or "Super Strong". Characteristics do not have numeric ratings--they are either present or absent. Characters also start with ten Skills--areas in which they stand out from the normal mass of people. Sample Skills are "Fireball" and "5 lb. Telekinesis". Generally speaking, Characters are assumed to be successful in Skill use. Characters also have Plot Points which may be spent to influence events.

During combat or other intense situations Characters must perform actions during Action Rounds. During Action Rounds, Skills may only be successfully used if the player rolls a good result on 1d12, adjusted by one or two Plausibility Modifier scores. Results of 7+ are deemed successful, while results of 6 or less are narrated by the opponent. About half of the brief rules are devoted to rating Plausibility Modifiers.

185062.name: Casus Belli (v4, Issue 14 - Mar/Apr 2015)
rpgissuearticle: D3: Règles de début de Campagne
Le Foyer - Manna Renay & le Yerval
Le Gambit de la Plaie du Monde
Le kit du maître de Jeu
Les chemins de la mémoire - Scénario 3: Fausse pistes
Les chemins de la mémoire - Scénario 4: Piéger les piégeurs
New York Gigant - suite et fin !
Recueil de la société des éclaireurs
v6 vs v7, le Grand Comparatif
185062.description:
(Translated) from the cover


D3 part 2: rules and scenario
Star Wars, Within, Americana
Call of Cthulhu 7
New York Gigant 3: final chaper, universe + scenario, Chronique Oubliées contemporary
Analysis: Crowdfunding & JdR figures and interviews
Scenarios: Pathfinder, CoC, X-Corps, The One Ring, Shadowrun 5 & Chroniques oubliées

185063.name: M.R.E. Core Rules
185063.description:
User summary:

The M.R.E. Core Rules detail the generic, universal processes utilized in the MRE - Microcosm Roleplaying Engine game system. Character creation is free-from, with characters having 2-12 Attributes; all characters have the same Attributes, so the decision of which to use is left to the GM. Examples include: Two Attributes (Body, Mind); Three Attributes (Body, Mind, Spirit); Four Attributes (Talent, Perceptiveness, Might, Sociability) and so forth. Attributes are assigned an Attribute Magnitude, or performance level, ranging from 0 to 4, with 2 being typical. Characters also have an assigned Role which is somewhat analogous to the more-traditional Class but functions primarily as a narrative tag denoting presumed ability. Examples include: "Agent ('Mulder' Style)", "Agent ('007' Style)", and "Mage ('Necromancer')". Roles are assigned a Role Magnitude to denote how adept the character is within the Role; ranks range from 1-3. Characters may select 2-4 Roles.

One atypical aspect of the game focuses on Resources, and Detailed Tracking is suggested. In this system every Attribute or Role use (except the very trivial) is assumed to dissipate some amount of applicable Resource. Usually, Characters may expend additional Resource to gain a performance advantage.

Actions are referred to as Tasks, and Task Resolution follows a similar pattern of base score plus 1d6 compared to a target difficulty. Any Task may use a suitable Tool (if such is at hand) to give a performance bonus. Characters gain Experience Points and spend them to increase Attribute Ranks.

185064.name: M.R.E. Lite
185064.description:
User summary:

The M.R.E. Lite rules are very similar to the M.R.E. Core rules except they are less theoretical and somewhat less flexible. Characters have ten Attributes (Agility, Dexterity, Strength, Constitution, Intellect, Perception, Charisma, Willpower, Size, and Speed). Attributes are assigned an Attribute Magnitude, or performance level, ranging from 0 to 3, with 2 being typical. Characters also have an assigned Role which is somewhat analogous to the more-traditional Class but functions primarily as a narrative tag denoting presumed ability. Examples include: "Agent", "Human Lightning Rod", and "Mage". Roles are assigned a Role Magnitude to denote how adept the character is within the Role; ranks range from 1-3. Characters may select 2-4 Roles.

One atypical aspect of the game focuses on Resources. In this system every Attribute or Role use (except the very trivial) is assumed to dissipate some amount of applicable Resource. Usually, Characters may expend additional Resource to gain a performance advantage.

Actions are referred to as Tasks, and Task Resolution follows a similar pattern of base score plus 1d6 compared to a target difficulty. Any Task may use a suitable Tool (if such is at hand) to give a performance bonus. Characters gain Experience Points and spend them to increase Attribute Ranks.

185065.name: M.R.E. Weapons
185065.description:
User summary:

M.R.E. Weapons presents an enormous list of weapons. Each weapon is given a name, a damage rating and type, and (possibly) some special characteristics. For example:

Axe, Battle - +3 Cutting - -1 Parrying

Weapons are grouped into categories, including Melee Weapons, Thrown Weapons, Guns, Bows, and Crossbows. Guns have some additional comments regarding ammunition, rate of fire, and range. Bows and Crossbows, likewise, have a few other comments.

185066.name: M.R.E. Enlightenment
185066.description:
User summary:

M.R.E. Enlightenment (formerly titled "Reality Deviant") is a concise set of rules modifications to adapt the M.R.E. Core rules to a magical milieu drawing on Mage: The Ascension as inspiration. The document has specific implementation notes for the M.R.E. character creation system and introduces the magical concepts of Synergy, Occlusion, and Cosmology.

Note the document is not formatted particularly well and is also fairly incomplete in treatment of the subject.

185067.name: FANGS: Fantasy Adventure Networked Gaming System
rpg: FANGS: Fantasy Adventure Networked Gaming System
185067.description:
User summary:

In the system, Characters have Characteristics, which are physical or mental abilities. Attributes are derived from Characteristics. Characters also may have Advantages or Disadvantages. Characters also have one or more Skills which are specific talents and abilities. Characters purchase Characteristics, Advantages, and Skills from a Character Point pool (usually 100-200 points).

Characters have 7 Characteristics: Strength, Agility, Constitution, Intelligence, Power, Size, and Appeal. Attributes consist of things like Hit Points, Stun Points, Fatigue Points, Power Points, and Damage Modifiers and for the most part are derived values. Skills include Climb, Knife, Throw, Shield Parry, Drive Car, Pistol, Computer Ops, and so forth. Characters usually select one Professional Skill, one Weapon Skill, one Environment Skill, one Transportation Skill, and Literacy, spending 24 Skill Points among them.

Combat is fairly complex and three distinct methods are provided: Simple Combat, for streamlined encounters where the issue is in little doubt; Normal Combat, for typical use; and Mass Combat to handle large groups. Combat rules provide for a very wide variety of actions, offensive, defensive, and movement. The resulting combination of possibilities is complex.

Appendices include Equipment, Non-Human Races, Wizards, Priests, and Monsters.

185068.name: Alvatia
rpg: FANGS: Fantasy Adventure Networked Gaming System
185068.description:
From the introduction:

Alvatia is a 'low magic' fantasy campaign, set in a culture not too different from 14th Century England. Players can explore the many islands of Nyranim, encountering adventures as they go – sometimes unexpectedly. As they gain influence, they may control the fate of manors, counties, or entire nations – and gain allies and enemies.

User summary:

The campaign setting focuses almost exclusively on two well-developed locales: The "Village and Manor" of Ingsby, and the City of Wedburgh. Along with the HTML pages, bitmap images are also provided of area maps.

185069.description:
Von Moltke's Triumph recreates the decisive 1870 campaign of the Franco-Prussian War. Under Helmuth von Moltke the Elder, the German states used superior logistics, advanced artillery, and a strategy of envelopment to terrorize the sluggish and unprepared French.

Historically, it ended with the capitulation and capture of Napoleon III after a mere five weeks. The game slants historically but is intended for competitive play: the French will almost always lose the war, but a good French Player can win the game.

Tom Russell's designs tend to have unusual combat or activation mechanisms, but in this game he utilizes a mostly traditional, odds-based CRT and Logistics-Move-Combat sequence of play. A liberal strategic movement rule allows for lightning-fast encirclements, while subtle differences in each side's logistic phase, organizational structure, and the rounding of combat factors reflect the doctrinal and technological differences that proved decisive.
185069.name: Von Moltke's Triumph: Fall of the Second Empire, 1870

185070.name: Close Your Eyes
185070.description:
User Summary

A very simply animated game, it depends on atmosphere to intensify as you solve the puzzles to make progress. You are a murderer who has escaped the hangman's noose and are wandering through a nightmarish world to discover your way out. Strange video clues and an abandoned subway are only short steps on a longer trek. This game was originally offered as free-to-play, depending on its cash model by offering 'Goody Bag' DLC.

185071.description:
Requires Transmogrification and Advanced Transmogrification to play.

Increases the maximum player count to 8.

Adds 15 Original Form Cards, 15 Advanced Form Cards, and 30 Combat Style cards. Added to the cards included with Transmogrification and Advanced Transmogrification bring the total cards in play for 8 Player to 90.

No change in game play from the original game. Set-up, objective, play and winning remain the same as Transmogrification and Advanced Transmogrification.

Set Up
Each play gets one set of the four Form Cards. Unused Form Cards are set aside.

The Combat Style Cards are shuffled and dealt out until each player has an equal number. Un-dealt cards are set aside face down.

Objective
Be the first player to empty your hand of Combat Style Cards.

Play
Select a Form - Each player selects one Form Card from their stack of face down Form Cards and places in the center of the table but in front of them.

Select a Combat Style - Each player then selects one of their combat style cards from their hand and places it face down besides their form card.

Reveal - All cards are flipped face up.

Resolution: The success of a combat style depends on the form.
If successful, players put the Combat Style Card face down in the discard pile.
If unsuccessful, players put the combat style card back in their hand.

End of turn - Players put the Form Card they just used aside, face-up and return any previously used Form Cards back to their stack.

Winning
The game ends when a player ends a turn with no Combat Style Cards in their hand.
185071.name: Epic Transmogrification

185072.name: Comedy Quest
185072.description:
User Summary

You are an up-coming bad comedy stand-up star trying to go from club to club convincing people you have talent. Most times, they take advantage of you and you tell canned jokes with various results. The graphics are 8-bit retro and the accents are slightly English but there is a general light-hearted feel to game. You score is calculated as you do prescribed duties and posted in the top corner of the screen.

185073.description:
Sarah and Dinah are standing totally amazed in the zoo in front of the sea lions. Something is laying next to a rock with feathers on its back? "Does a sea lion have feathers like a bird or does it have fur like a dog?" Suddenly somebody claps their hands and the duck that was hiding behind the sea lions flies off quacking. Relieved, both of them laugh at each other after seeing that the sea lion doesn't have any feathers after all.

In Manimals: Loro Parque 1, players compete to find as many animals as possible with a certain characteristic. To start play, shuffle the animal cards, then spread forty of them on the table so that everyone can see them. Flip over one card, see the characteristic identified on this card, then race to pick up all animals that feature this characteristic. Once everyone has finished picking up cards, check all the cards collected to see whether anyone made a mistake; if so, that player must return the mistaken card and one correctly collected card.

Players repeat this process six more times, first laying out three more cards from the deck each time, then they see who has collected the most cards and won!

Manimals: Loro Parque 1 includes rule variants that allow for play with children as young as four.
185073.name: Manimals: Loro Parque 1

185074.description:
Sarah and Dinah are standing totally amazed in the zoo in front of the sea lions. Something is laying next to a rock with feathers on its back? "Does a sea lion have feathers like a bird or does it have fur like a dog?" Suddenly somebody claps their hands and the duck that was hiding behind the sea lions flies off quacking. Relieved, both of them laugh at each other after seeing that the sea lion doesn't have any feathers after all.

In Manimals: Serengeti-Park Hodenhagen, players compete to find as many animals as possible with a certain characteristic. To start play, shuffle the animal cards, then spread forty of them on the table so that everyone can see them. Flip over one card, see the characteristic identified on this card, then race to pick up all animals that feature this characteristic. Once everyone has finished picking up cards, check all the cards collected to see whether anyone made a mistake; if so, that player must return the mistaken card and one correctly collected card.

Players repeat this process six more times, first laying out three more cards from the deck each time, then they see who has collected the most cards and won!

Manimals: Serengeti-Park Hodenhagen includes rule variants that allow for play with children as young as four.
185074.name: Manimals: Serengeti-Park Hodenhagen

185075.name: The World of Farland (3.5th Edition)
185075.description:
From the introduction:

Farland is a unique fantasy RPG campaign setting of grand proportions. This is a world that has been conquered by evil. It has been sundered into seven kingdoms, each ruled by an evil lord who personifies one of the seven deadly sins. These beings, called the Seven Deadly Lords or the Lords of Sin, hold the land in a dark grasp. In the conquered kingdoms, the Lords of Sin enslaved the population and made their primary activity in life the glorification of the Dark God Vornoth. Farland is an evil place but take heart, for not all is lost-- light glimmers in the West. Three kingdoms have recently been freed, and the battlelines are drawn between the East and the West. The clouds of war are gathering...

185076.name: The World of Farland (4th Edition)
185076.description:
From the introduction:

The World of Farland is a meticulously mapped and detailed campaign setting designed to be used with the Fourth Edition of the World's most popular Roleplaying game, Dungeons & Dragons®. Farland has a detailed history spanning many millenia, providing a rich, realistic backdrop that many campaign settings lack. Every clue and detail that players discover will lead them to further, nearly limitless aspects of the world, providing an immersive gaming experience.

185077.name: The World of Farland (5th Edition)
185077.description:
From the introduction:

Farland is a world that has been conquered by evil. It has been sundered into seven kingdoms, each ruled by an evil lord who personifies one of the seven deadly sins. These beings, called the Seven Deadly Lords or the Lords of Sin, hold the land in a dark grasp. In the conquered kingdoms, the Lords of Sin enslaved the population and made their primary activity in life the glorification of the Dark God Vornoth. Farland is an evil place but take heart, for not all is lost--light glimmers in the West...

185078.name: Fantasized Adventures
185078.description:
User summary:

Fantasized Adventures is available online as HTML or can be downloaded as multiple DOC files. The HTML formatting is difficult to use because the material is divided into quite small units. It is a rules-heavy game with much complexity.

Characters have an Occupation, which is somewhat analogous to a Class found in typical RPGs though less restrictive and less significant. Characters also have nine Attributes (Agility, Appearance, Constitution, Dexterity, Intelligence, Leadership, Luck, Strength, and Wisdom) that are randomly generated wish scores ranging from 3-18 before racial adjustments. The game supports "Exceptional Attributes" for high scores. Characters also calculate a RALF (Roll Attribute Luck Factor) Score and calculate Action Points (how much a character can do during a round) and Movement Points (how far a character can move during a round). Each Attribute has a variety of effects on various classes and the relationships become quite complex. Characters gain Experience and can advance in Rank.

Characters use Skills by, generally, rolling d100 and trying to roll below their situational modified Skill Rank. However, Skills have assigned Letter Codes and other nuances that make Skill resolution complicated. Combat generally is resolved with a d20 compared to a "to hit" calculation, but again numerous modifiers and rules come into play making the entire process complex.

The rules are tightly linked to a unique setting, with e.g. special rules carried throughout for several unique races and various Skills depending upon race, occupation, or region. However, the primary definition of the setting is found in a companion work, The World of Ba'Kara.

185079.name: The World of Ba'Kara
185079.description:
User summary:

The World of Ba'Kara is published online as a series of HTML pages. Ba'Kara is the primary setting for the Fantasized Adventures RPG. Known Ba'Kara is divided into six independent Arch-Duchies, three of which are detailed: Hemel, Haverford, and Warton.

Hemel is the most detailed, with the Capital City of Hemel, the towns of Cambe, Carrack, Doonbert, Nenag, Sisak, and Thurles, and the village of Selmoth. Haverford details only the City of Haverford, and Warton is only partially defined. In addition to the HTML descriptions, several color maps are provided.

185080.description:
Wildwood is a card game in which two players, or two teams, compete to call Druids and build the most fitting Grove.

Each round you draw three cards. From those cards, you decide which to use as a bid to call a Druid, which to place in your face-down back row for end-game scoring, and which to place in your face-up front row as a source of effects.

The Druids you have successfully called add scoring bonuses, the ability to rearrange your cards and those of your opponents, and other special effects.

At the end of the sixth round, you score your back row. You count the face value of the cards you have placed within it, bonuses granted by the Druids you have called, and you also gain bonus points for suit or number matches you have created.

Team play adds chances to meaningfully cooperate with your teammates, and to read and respond to the other team's gameplay as it unfolds.
185080.name: Wildwood

185081.name: Beast Master Tale
185081.description:
A player becomes Kyuubi and travels through the corrupting world.
While fighting with Beasts, you will gain allies, collect sacred treasures,
and train up your party.
Your goal is to go to the celestial realm, fight against Izanami,
and win before the world completely perishes.

■ Objective of the game
When either of the following two are fulfilled, the game ends.

① Victory in decisive battle
Fight against "Izanami," whom the decisive battle board indicates.
When a player wins the battle,
the game immediately ends and the player will be the winner of the game.

② Destruction of the world
At the end of a turn, when 8 land boards are face down,
except for "The Road to celestial realm," the game ends.
The world is destroyed and all players will lose the game.

■ Game flow
You will repeat destruction phase and travel phase.

1, Destruction phase
A bad beast begins to appear in the peaceful world under the influence of Izanami.
The world where two bad beasts appeared becomes the destruction.

2, travel phase
Start the game from the player with Jewel token, and ao around once clockwise.

■ Play
① Move
Move your own kyuubi token.

② Encounter
If there is a Beast card on your Kyuubi token, you will start a battle.

③ Effect of land
Execute the land effect, where your Kyuubi token stays.

■ End of battle and rewards

Victory




• If you win the battle, you get either of the following two rewards.
① Acquire the enemy card
② Acquire experience value

■ Decisive battle
You will battle against Izanami in a decisive battle.
Its strength is determined by the position of decisive battle status cubes.

When you win the battle against Izanami, you will be the winner of the game!

■ Items
① jewel token
A player, who has a jewel, plays the game in journey phase first.

② mirror token
A card that has a mirror token placed on it acquires magic attack power value,
which is equal to the number of cards of the player's party, except the Kyuubi card.

③ sword token
A card that has a sword token placed on it acquires physical attack power value,
which is equal to the number of cards of the player's party, except the Kyuubi card.


Herb


If you use a herb, you can recover up to 3 strengths of any one card of your party.

185082.name: The Slaver's Lash
185082.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure for starting characters by Chris Pramas

The emperor’s death and the subsequent collapse of the Empire loosed rampaging bands of orcs into the Empire’s provinces. While many of these orcs seek the freedom long denied to them, others see opportunity for vengeance, wealth, and power. In this adventure, a band of orc slavers has moved into the Northern Reach, plundering frontier towns for slaves to sell or use for sport. When the adventure opens, the characters are among the captives, marching toward a life in chains. The adventure ends when the characters escape captivity and reach one of the few outposts of civilization on the frontier.

185083.name: A Year Without Rain
185083.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure for starting characters by Bruce Cordell

The killings begin as the drought afflicting the town of Asylum threatens to stretch into another year. Townsfolk, dead and dry as shed snakeskins, their bodies papery and crumbling, turn up night after night. Who or what is killing the good people of Asylum is what the player characters must discover in this adventure. The characters eventually find that it’s something living down in the well—which is the one remaining source of water for miles around.

185084.description:
Given away by pre-ordering CapCom Street Fighter Deck-Building Game directly from Cryptozoic.

This promo allows you to select Blanka as character that you represent during the game. Blanka's ability is:

Counter-Attack: Gain a Weakness for each card with cost 6 or greater in your discard pile.

Blanka's Ultra card is:

Lightning Cannonball

+ 2 Power

Attack: Each foe gains a Weakness, and then discards all Starter cards from his hand.
Defense: You may shuffle this card into your deck to avoid an Attack. If you do, draw a card and Counter-Attack against the attacker.
185084.name: CapCom Street Fighter Deck-Building Game: Blanka Promo

185085.name: Planetary Transmission (Issue 2 - Sep 2015)
185085.description:
From publisher blurb:

We're back with issue two of Planetary Transmission to help inspire white-box Referees and players alike!

Planetary Transmission is a fanzine dedicated to bringing more old school (mixed with a little new school) goodness to the White Star RPG

185086.name: Decahedron (Issue 3 - Sep 2015)
185086.description:
From publisher blurb:

Decahedron is a magazine designed to support the BareBones Fantasy RPG. It contains articles written by gamers like you. Originally, this was intended to be a paid-for publication containing material DwD Studios produced, along with some fan-generated content in a profit-sharing model. However, due to the popularity of the game and the ever-growing community, we wanted to continue our roots of community development like we have done with our other fan-based products and sites.

This magazine is something we can all develop together and be proud of. Designed to be small, lite, but full of fun content, we hope you enjoy this issue, as we plan on many more to come. As long as gamers are contributing content they’ll have a place within the pages of Decahedron.

Within issue you'll find:

Another great cover by Joe Calkins.
A spotlight on Ben Gorman, a great game and friend.
New equipment and a short example of magic item values.
D100 tables we enjoy, this one is for things found in a pocket. Also contains a short Odor table.
Gaming Options for your table; Fame Rules, finding mundane ingredients (for use in magic items and potions), Schools of Magic, more equipment, Merchant Cash Flow (pacing your players income).
A-Z Useful Herbs, lots of one shot and fun herbs for any game.
Crystal Aberration, a new creature and short adventure by Larry Moore
Tentown Bay, a map by Bill Logan. A collection of ten independent towns bowing to no king, the merchant houses of the region deal swiftly with pirates and bandits as they compete for glory and profit. Adventurers can make a name for themselves spying or doing odd jobs for one of the merchant houses or for the Lords of Tentown themselves.

185087.name: Minotarr
185087.description:
From publisher blurb:

The running of the bull... Minotarr!

A Power Level 12 Rogue, Minotarr is a brute your players will love to hate. This thuggish fool has been cursed with great power, despite having no sense of responsibility! Not the world's most inspiring leader, he still brings with him a number of power level 7 thugs who're just as obnoxious and bull-headed (well, figuratively) as their leader. Minotarr is a classic villain archetype in the Beacon City universe, but can be dropped into any campaign with very little alteration.

Minotarr is designated "Violet" for his magical origins. This can attract the attention of heroes of a mystic bent who aren't used to dealing with foes who are so direct in their villainy or methods of combat. Of course, because Minotarr holds grudges easily, he makes a great nemesis for any hero who stands between him and whatever he wants to grab by force. Editor's Note: Paired with Ticktock, Minotarr makes for a fun "Old West" themed episode of your game. Your players may get a lot of mileage out of bull puns at his expense!

185088.name: Master of the Way (Hybrid Class)
185088.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue introduces a new hybrid class, the Master of the Way. Combining the martial arts of the monk with the divine healing and spell casting abilities of the cleric, the master of the way's unarmed attack can really punch it up with power. New feats designed for the Master of the Way, new spells, and magic items are included.

185089.name: "T" is for "Teams"
185089.description:
From publisher blurb:

Icons ... Assemble!

T is for Teams looks at the mainstay of the superhero genre, the team, and team dynamics in Icons game terms including:

Spelling out the benefits of being on a team.
Team qualities and how to choose them.
Using team qualities and shared activations as a part of teamwork.
Using trouble caused by hero qualities as trouble for the whole team.
Villain teams and teamwork.

185090.name: Night of the Carver
185090.description:
From publisher blurb:

RUSTLE, RUSTLE AND SNICKITY SNACK!

Every year, the city of Malifaux is plagued by a series of violent murders that eventually culminate in a brutal slaughter on All Hallow’s Eve. On that haunted night, the wise stay indoors, lest they find themselves screaming at the end of the Carver’s blades.

Malifaux Nightmares explore the darker characters that lurk in the shadows of the Malifaux universe. Night of the Carver is a Through the Breach one shot horror adventure that also contains three bonus Encounters for Malifaux.

185091.name: In the Gutter
185091.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wolves in sheep's clothing.

In the Gutter takes players into the Quarantine Zone as they try to scrape together enough money to pull themselves out of poverty.

Of course, nothing is quite what it seems. There's more than just criminals and undead lurking beyond the barricade walls ...

185092.name: Legacy of Darkness
185092.description:
From publisher blurb:

There is a Legacy.

Sixteen hundred years ago, the bloodthirsty Kotaro Shu cut a swathe of destruction across ancient China. She was an unpleasant memory that her descendants were happy to forget, and form any long years, she was silent in her tomb.

Then the Cortez Expedition showed up to dig the warlord up and cart her off to Malifaux. Now, they're about to learn that some things are best left forgotten...

185093.name: Crashed Ufo
185093.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 271st of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features an Ufo after a crash landing in the desert.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4032x4320 pixels in size at 144dpi.

185094.name: counterfeit
185094.description:
You are in the currency exchange market. You will be trading money with other players.
You will have some possible secret partners. You can find out who your partner is or find out which currency is fake. There will be a secret card that shows the currency or the numbered bill that is fake for that round. Be the player with most money at the end.
Don't get fooled by the counterfeit bills.

Contents:
50 cards (1$, 2$, 5$, $10, $20) x 2 of 5 currencies
10 counterfeit round cards (5 money denominations, 5 of the currency)
15 secret player cards (3 of each that represent the 5 currencies)
50 score sheets (or provide your own paper and pencil)
1 starting coin

Set up:
Choose a dealer by drawing from the money cards, highest amount wins. If a ties everyone can draw and add total.
Place the starting coin in front of the dealer. Shuffle and place one counterfeit card in the center.
Deal one secret player card to each player, put the rest aside.
Deal 5 currency cards to each player. (4-5 players deal 4)

Play:
The person to the right of the dealer will start.
Their first action is to choose one face down card to look at.
They can look at another player's secret card or the featured counterfeit card in the center of the table.
After the player secretly looks they pass one money card to the player of their choice.
This card will remain face down on the table, not to be confused with the money in the players hands.
play then continues to the next player.
Repeat same action.

Play will continue for 5 full rounds, until everyone has used all the money in their hands.
Once all the money has been played everyone will reveal their secret identity cards.
They will flip over the money they have in front of them.
They will flip the counterfeit card in the center of the table.

Scoring:
Each player scores the amount of money in front of them
They also score the same amount as a person with the same identity
Ex. If player A has $21 and Player C has $9 and both are on the blue team, they both will get $30 for that round.


Any currency or denomination that matches the counterfeit card in the center is void.


Conclusion:
After the first round, write down each player's score.
Move the dealer coin to the next player.
The money and identity cards will be dealt.
The counterfeit cards remain in the center, once one is used, it is out.

Play continues for 5 rounds or till each player gets to start, your choice. Total up all the rounds, player with the most cash wins.

185095.name: Lands of Luste
185095.description:
User summary:

Lands of Luste is both a parody and a roleplaying game system. Characters have Attributes and Abilities which are a blend of standard roleplaying components and adult-themed components. The mechanics do handle combat and adventure, but predominantly are concerned with various forms of perverse sexual activity. The game includes seven pre-generated characters, an equipment list (a blend of standard equipment and sexually specialized equipment), two bestiary chapters, and a sample module.

Well illustrated, color, high production standards, for adults only.

185097.name: Cyclades: Wooden Pawns
185097.description: With this goodie, you start the game with the wooden pawns of the very first version of Cyclades to replace your plastic figurines.

185098.name: Cyclades: Hades – Wooden Pawns
185098.description: With this goodie, you play with the Hades extension and wooden pawns.

185101.name: Cyclades: Titans – Purple Die
185101.description: A 6th purple die, matching the 6th army that comes in the Titans expansion.

185102.description: Adventurers time are now represented by finely carved and all different characters + 55 Khronos cards (identical to the game) except they are linen and stronger.
185102.name: Khronos: Figurines and Linen Cards

185104.name: Monopoly: Game of Thrones Collector's Edition
185104.description:
Play as one of the great houses in this Monopoly: Game of Thrones Collector's Edition and employ your cunning and wit to determine who will hold dominion over the realms of men.

-Description from back of box

185105.name: Urban Thievery
185105.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Urban Thievery, an HTML Adventure by Fatal Games. Although we hope you enjoy this adventure, it also serves as a tutorial to playing a pick pocket in F.A.T.A.L. Knowledge of F.A.T.A.L. is not required, but recommended. To participate in this adventure, you need a set of role-playing dice, most importantly three 10-sided dice. Scratch paper and a pen or pencil are also necessary, for example, so you can keep track your character’s money.

To participate in this adventure, read the text until you are prompted either to make a decision or roll dice. When you make a decision, click on the hyperlink that corresponds best with your decision. This adventure does not attempt to list all possible decisions, or places where decisions may be made, but offers decisions important to the adventure. When prompted to roll dice, roll the appropriate dice on a hard surface.

When prompted to make a skill check, you will be asked to roll 3d10. This means that you must roll three 10-sided dice. Sum the results. Next, a modifier may be listed on the screen. Apply the modifier to your sum. Consider your result and report it by clicking on the appropriate hyperlink. Higher results are better for your character.

What do you do?

User summary:

An online, HTML-only, "choose your own adventure" type scenario. Generally, each page ends with two options. Occasional dice rolls are required. Various endings are possible.

185106.name: F.A.T.A.L. on CD-ROM
185106.description:
User summary:

A combination product distributed as CD-ROM, including:

- F.A.T.A.L. RPG (PDF)
- Chant Generator
- Character Generator
- Delivery Penalty Generator
- Disposition Test
- Temperament Test
- Wallpapers
- Customer Support
- Customer Survey

185107.name: F.A.T.A.L. Audio CD
185107.description:
From the advertisement:

[Y]ou'll never get a better introduction to F.A.T.A.L.! A sorcerer atop a mountain conjures information about F.A.T.A.L., and unleashes a demon in the process!

This CD introduces the game by providing audio samples of various races, dispositions, and temperaments. In addition, two musical pieces are included. Both are hilarious, and the musical instruments are played with superior dexterity.

User summary:

Audio CD containing 24 audio tracks for use with the game.

185108.name: Mr. Richter
185108.description:
Mr. Richter is a children's game that has a head without features. On players turn, they start the timer, draw a card and quickly try to put the correct features on the face that match the face on the card. If they get all the features on, they can press the button & stop the timer. If they do not, the face explodes, releasing all the features.

The game can be played cooperatively, with players quickly putting on a feature one at a time and the one holding a feature when the face explodes loses.

The game can also be played with each player trying to build the entire face on his turn. If the face explodes, that player is out.
