Robin Hood is one of the better known motifs outside of licensed properties, and so was chosen as the first instance of Nickel & Dime.

185241.description:
Victory & Glory: Napoleon (Board Game Version)

Victory & Glory: Napoleon is a game of grand strategy and fast-play tactical battles where one player will take the role of Napoleon Bonaparte and attempt to dominate the entire continent of Europe while the other player controls Great Britain and the other allied nations and troops that comprise an ever-changing alliance bent on stopping Napoleon! They will move armies and navies, fight epic battles, recruit new troops, and add new regions to their domain.
Can you carve out a European empire that will survive the growing threat from perfidious Albion and her allies (or prevent Europe from being dominated by France)? Can you change history and do better than L’Empereur?

Features:
• Re-fight the entire Napoleonic Wars!
• A game that is easy to learn, but challenging to master.
• Strategic Level map of Europe from 1800 – 1818.
• Dozens of unique unit types (cavalry, infantry, artillery, and generals for each major nation and several minor nations).
• Almost 100 unique ‘Event Cards’ with artwork by world-renowned Napoleonic Artist: Keith Rocco. Each card gives the player special unit upgrades, advantages in battle, new recruits, historical events, or political actions that can change the alliances or borders of the French Empire.
• Land and Naval Battles utilizing a fast-play abstracted tactical battle system.
• More detailed tactical battle system also available for larger battles.
• Never plays the same way twice. Infinitely re-playable.
• 2 Players (Solo play and multi-player rules also included).
• 4 – 6 Hours

Includes six unique scenarios with different starting conditions:
• 1800: The Second Coalition
• 1805: The Dash for the Danube
• 1806: Who’s Next?
• 1809: The Austrian Phoenix and the Spanish Quagmire
• 1812: Into Russia
• 1813: Defending the Empire
185241.name: Victory and Glory: Napoleon
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 007 – Board Game Terms

185242.description:
This pack consists of the following five promo cards that were previously released separately.

4 Wu-Feng cards: B-Rice Lee, Chuck No-Rice, Jean-Claude Van Rice and Steven Qi-Gal.
1 Ghost card: Crazy Shaman

These cards were originally released as downloadable pdfs and later obtainable at certain game conventions.

All cards can be used with the base game and any of the expansions, with the exception of the Steven Qi-Gal card, which requires the White Moon expansion.
185242.name: Ghost Stories: Promo Pack

185243.description:
In Rise of Man: Stone Age, you are a tribal leader, and you’ll have to gather actual resources from the Stone Age period to triumph. You’ll fight saber tooth tigers, hunt woolly mammoths, gather food and herbs, build shelters, weather the environment, and overcome any obstacle that the Stone Age will throw at you.

Rise of Man: Stone Age is a strategic card drafting board game. Players will choose Resources specific to the Stone Age to overcome Obstacles and Hazards that they will face in each of the 5 Rounds of play.

As tribal leaders, players must overcome a new Obstacle (or Hazard) in each of the 5 rounds of play by choosing and accumulating suitable Resource cards. At the end of each Round, players earn points for overcoming Obstacles, but lose points by failing to overcome their Obstacles. Resource cards accumulate each round so that players can also play “Special Events” to earn additional points. Special Events are played by using different combinations of specific Resource Cards. Special Events include Chieftain, Feast, Shaman, and many others.

You’ll build a life for yourself and your tribe to really create something worth fighting for. Here, it’s not victory or defeat, but life or death, and it’s all up to the choices that you make.
185243.name: Rise of Man: Stone Age
boardgamepodcastepisode: 16 Devon Dice Podcast Scythe summer nights

185244.name: Autumn
185244.description:
Autumn, a game of paths and falling leaves, is a 18 cards minigame.

In Autumn each player takes turns placing a card on other previously played cards. Each card shows four groups of leaves and, in order to play it, you should place it overlapping other cards in play, covering one or two groups. The goal is being the player with the largest area of connected leaves at the end of the game.

185245.name: The Fifth Element
185245.description:
A Role-Playing Scenario for Cyno's Role-Play

User summary:

The Fifth Element adapts the setting from the 1997 Luc Besson film The Fifth Element into a setting and adventure for Cyno's Role-Play. The product is nominally referred to as an "RPG" but it is, instead, clearly an adventure as no mechanics or rules are presented.

The scenario itself is quite brief, essentially little more than background information and an introductory scene. The remainder of the adventure will either be up to the GM or will need to follow the film script (links to various film resources, including an online script, were provided but are no longer active).

Apart from the scenario itself, included DM resources are: two races, four professions, five skills, seven items (mostly weapons), six vehicles, and ten major NPCs (Korben, Leeloo, etc.). The detail provided is uneven even within a category. All items conform closely to the film portrayal.

185246.name: AGES
185246.description:
AGES is a deckbuilding card game with a historical theme. In this game, each player will travel to historical events and exotic locations while seeking the help of the historical Elite.

Have you ever visited a museum? Did you see displays filled with prints of paintings, replicas of rare artifacts, and animatronic presidents? Did you ever wish you could see the real thing?

Welcome to AGES, a Deckbuilding card game designed for 2 to 4 players, ages 14+. The average game will last 30-60 minutes.

In AGES, each player will travel back in time to collect artifacts, historical figures, locations, and check out famous events throughout the history of mankind. Whoever assembles the greatest historical collection will be the winner.

Wage a war of the ages as you travel through time recruiting history's most influential people. Which path will you choose? Will you take solace in Art? Will you go the path of the righteous and seek out the Good? Or will you go the path of the conqueror and seek out Evil? Perhaps the knowledge contained within Science? The choice is yours.

Along the way, players will need to pick up various Icons to activate the cards they purchase. To do this, players need to remember that AGES isn't just the name of the game, it's also an acronym: Art, Good, Evil, and Science

So get ready to talk strategy with Napoleon, visit the California Gold Rush, and hold the Dead Sea Scrolls in your hands.

Play continues until a face-up supply of cards representing key historical individuals has been exhausted with victory going to the player with the highest point total.

185247.name: Of Dreams and Magic
185247.description:
From the back of the book:

Become an Anima.

Break the Doubt and cast off its oppressive influence. Unlock the power of your dreams and make magic real. See the Waking World with a dreamer's eyes and uncover the mystic denizens that live shoulder to shoulder with the rest of humanity. Places of myth, artifacts of power - learn all you can and be ready to face your own nightmares. Reavers will hunt you, the Doubt will pressure you, and groups like M.O.X. will seek to put you down, but stand tall and fight for your dreams, however strange or wonderful they may be.

Come learn about a society of dreamers who wield magic, standing divided on what it all means and how to deal with it. Dreams are their battlefields, so come wage war against the Doubt and learn the truth all Anima cling to.

Magic is Real, and Dreams Matter.

185248.name: Five-Point Fudge: A Character Generation System
185248.description:
From the introduction:

Five-point Fudge is a character creation system for Fudge, suitable for newcomers to Fudge, both new and experienced role-players...Five-point Fudge is specifically aimed at those players who feel lost when first reading Fudge. It can be intimidating and confusing at first to read a game with so many options – one doesn’t know where to begin. Five-point Fudge gives you an easy beginning point: a set way to make a character to see if you might like this game.

185249.description:
Expansion for the Kickstarter edition of Epic. Released in a shrink-wrapped cards-only package (no box), outside the main box.

Contents:

- 12 Year one promos
- 8 Kickstarter exclusive promos
- 8 Alternate art tokens
- 4 Demigod cards
- 4 God cards
185249.name: Epic Card Game: Kickstarter expansion

185250.name: Role Playing Notes for the Firefly Universe
185250.description:
Roleplaying in the Firefly Universe

From the document:

The appearance of FIREFLY in 2002 was a breath of fresh air in the science fiction scene. Breaking free of the tradition of latex layered aliens and sterile societies in a formless future, Firefly offered a grittier view of a human frontier that had to reach back into the simpler technologies of the Earth frontiers.

User summary:

The document (through Version 0.6a) was intended to be utilized with the "Mayonnaise for Firefly" roleplaying system. "Mayonnaise" was a variation on the rules presented in Fuzion. When the present document was updated to Version 0.7a all references to "Mayonnaise" were removed, leaving the document a generic resource for nearly any game system. Some of the weapons entries still include categorizations that apply to Fuzion, though they are quite generic. The document also suggests the contents would be quite suitable for the HERO System.

185251.name: Alphamech
185251.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you have what it takes to face the meanest machine on the planet? Do you? DO YOU!?! Alphamech is the deadliest, toughest merc anywhere. Just ask him and he'll tell you. And then give you a beatdown for needing to ask. The mind of the most macho marine to ever sing the corps' hymn stuck in the best robot combat machine Uncle Sam's money can pay to have reverse-engineered from recovered alien technology -- he's ready to take your money to put the hurt on whoever you want. Who's ready to make his next payday?

Alphamech is a PL 12 threat to add to your Mutants & Masterminds campaign.

185252.name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 51 - Sep 30, 2015)
185252.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #51: Mutated Animal/Plant Genotypes

When a player character wishes to play a mutated animal or plant, he has several choices to make. Animals alone represent a large category but can actually be mammal, reptile, amphibian, avian, or even insect, and plants are no less diverse. Most animals have different types of advantages and disadvantages — some are very strong, while others are very agile, some can fly, some breathe water. Plant capabilities and drawbacks can be even more strange and profound.

What kind of animal do you want to play? How “human” do you want your animal character to be? Do you want to be able to use weapons and tools? Do you want to be able to talk? Walk like a human? This expanded issue of Wisdom from the Wastelands answers those questions and guides you through the process of playing a mutated animal or plant character!

185253.name: No Escape from New York
185253.description:
From publisher blurb:

Look what the cat dragged in!

This is New York City as only Crimson Dragon Slayer could imagine it. Filthy, funny, and fucking weird... No Escape from New York is the second mini-module for the old school, gonzo science-fantasy RPG Crimson Dragon Slayer (Descent into the Candy Crypts is the first).

The book is a dark, smutty love letter to the rotten apple circa 1983, when Times Square and 42nd Street were doing it up right. You'll see a dozen or more of your favorite films and TV shows given the homage/parody treatment.

Best of all... this is more or less compatible with any OSR game that uses Hit Dice, Armor Class, etc. No Escape from New York is 85% of a full-fledged micro-campaign just waiting for your grimy, crimson-soaked fingertips. Caress this PDF if you dare!

185254.name: Five by Five (3rd Ed.)
185254.description:
From the web site introduction:

Five by Five is a "choose your trait" style RPG that makes unique use of six-sided dice to create an easy to learn and easy to play universal game system. The game is flexible enough to satisfy a variety of settings and easy enough to pick up and play right away.

The core of the system is the 5×5 die roll. Players roll two dice (reading a 6 as "0") and multiply the results. This gives an average unskilled person around a 30% chance of success and each rank of skill improves this chance by 5½ percent.

The game includes sample adventures for both a fantasy setting and a superhero game, example characters and a character sheet.

185255.name: Crimson Dragon Slayer
185255.description:
From publisher blurb:

Take science-fantasy gonzo, then add 80's sleaze and cheese!

This is my own contribution to the OSR / fantasy heartbreaker genere of paper & pencil roleplaying games. Crimson Dragon Slayer is heavily inspired by the 1980's. The parts of it that are god-awful are god-awful on purpose (mostly). Your adventuring party might contain a robot ranger with laser sword, infernal elf wizard with machine gun, and crystalline / pixie fairy princess hybrid brandishing a two-handed dagger, all tooling around in a Mel Gibson interceptor... looking for cyber crowns, magic items, and bodacious bimbos. Can you bring Lord Varkon down before his crimson dragons rip Thule a new one?

So, what's in it? A self-contained system that's not d20, yet mostly compatible with the original fantasy roleplaying game and all the clones published since. You roll multiple d6s, the higher the better, relying on improvisation more than defacto results. There are several classes and many races to choose from. Also, strange yet eerily familar spells, magic items, monsters, and the mother of all name generators!

If all goes well, it will be like pretending you're a wizard or warrior in the backyard waving a stick around as if it was a staff or sword... put a tattered red sweatervest on the dog, maybe he can be the dragon.

There's also an introductory adventure at the end featuring all-too-familiar 80's film characters, several arcade game monsters, and stuff that Lovecraft was too ashamed to write about.

185256.name: Manic Monster Mayhem
185256.description:
Manic Monster Mayhem is a hilarious story-telling card game. Fend off terrifying monsters like the T-Rex with everyday objects, wit and a sharp tongue!



You’re walking down the street with a balloon in your hand, chewing gum in your mouth and a skunk on your shoulder. You’re just about to call your best friend, as you see a zombie that’s slowly approaching you on a unicycle. You can’t run, you can’t hide, so what are you gonna do? You’ve got 4 objects at hand…Manic Monster Mayhem is a card game about stopping monsters with everyday objects.

3-5 players
~30-45 min

How it works:

Each player gets 4 different objects, with which they have to stop beasts like a T-Rex on a pogo-stick from attacking. How they get rid of that beast is up to them – defeating, bribing, seducing, scaring... everything goes. Almost.

But since there are no heroines or brave adventurers among them, our poor players have to face ghastly monsters with ordinary things like spoons, lemons, vacuum cleaners and ladders. So the only way to succeed is using their wit and creativity – alright, a sharp tongue might be helpful as well…

Setup:
- Each player takes a pen and a piece of paper and writes his/her name on it
- Draw 1 Monster and put it in the middle of the table
- Hand out 4 item cards to each player
- Select starting player

As soon as the game is set up and a monster has been selected, our "heoroes" have to tell the others how they defeat the gharstly beast. Hereby the players take turns, beginning with the starting player.

Once all players have told their story, they secretly vote for the best one, writing the name of that player down. Afterwards a new round begins and a new player becomes the starting player.

After every monster has been defeated (number of monster = number of players) and everyone has voted, the grumpiest player counts the votes and announces the winner!

185257.description:
A deluxe box set of Innovation and all its expansions.

All are presented in the third edition (Asmadi) style.
185257.name: Innovation Deluxe

185260.name: Don'Yoku
185260.description:
User Summary

A strange imagining of post-WW1 planes with an amine feel. You play one of three characters with specific shooting patterns to their WW1 planes against a confusing array of other WW1 planes, WW2 planes (and tanks), and stuff that looks like alien spacecraft, all shooting blue and pink weapons that slowly move across the screen towards you. The animation and action are similar to other shoot 'em ups from this era, like Crimzon Clover, but this game has a button to convert all enemy bombs into coins. There are 5 levels (and bosses), although the game difficulty changes depending on how many coins you have greedily (貪欲 Don-Yoku) taken.

185261.description: A social deduction game in which players are an orchestra full of players working at cross purposes to try to make something approaching music (or "an orchestra"). Each player receives a role and must decide how to use its power, whether to trade the role with another and what they will say to help the manager reach their final decision regarding who to eject from the orchestra. When the manager makes their choice the game ends and everyone wins or loses based on their role - the manager wants to catch the artiste, the artiste wants to escape, most musicians want the manager to sort things out but a few have their own agendas.
185261.name: Shenanigans: The Musical

185262.name: Edge of Humanity
185262.description:
"We never saw it coming. Were we the one who fired first?" He asked himself as if it even mattered. The night’s sky, red as always, made him sigh. He felt lucky to even be alive, but can you even call this a life? "Is it time to move forward? Is it time to rebuild? Is there even a point?”

After a worldwide conflict that led to a chain reaction of events, civilization as we knew it ceased to exist and humanity is now at the brink of extinction. In this apocalyptic future, a group of survivors will try to raise hope for the human race by establishing a new civilized inception.

In Edge of Humanity , 2-5 survivors try to get enough victory points (VPs) to win the game. The game takes near 30 minutes of play and introduces a new take on deck-building, drafting, and hand management. The survivors explore and try to collect enough resources and rescue new survivors to maintain their everyday living. They encounter each round of play a new event that may affect many facets of their upcoming rounds of play.

185263.name: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 5
185263.description:
Like previous installments of the series, Pro Skater 5 will feature a list of playable professional skateboarders to play as, offering players the ability to customize their own skaters. The game will feature Create-A-Park, a feature last seen in 2005's American Wasteland. Created parks can be shared to the online community.

Source: Wikipedia, "Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 5", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

185264.name: The Incredible Hulk Game
185264.description:
Players start out as Banner, get angry and change into the Hulk, smashing everything in their path as they try to get to the Abomination.

The objective of the game is to knock the Abomination cube into your color's win area.

After moving Banner to a transformation square you take your turn by rolling two dice that can allow you to move, attack or revert back to Banner.

You are working against the other Hulk players to defeat the abomination yourself.

185265.name: Zed
185265.description:
From publisher blurb:

Zed is a fanatical agent of the Endgame Initiative - a corrupt rogue CHESS project from an alternate near-future timeline which parallels our own. He first travelled to our time-stream to infiltrate our dimension’s version of CHESS, in an attempt to trigger the start of the Endgame Initiative here. There are reports of an alternate version of Zed who calls himself Zeta, and is here to help rather than subvert our timeline. Caution is advised!

Zed is drawn by V&VTM co-creator and long-time gaimg industry artist Jeff Dee, who also wrote Living LegendsTM.

"FOE FILE #04: ZED" contains a briefing from TEACHER, the sentient computer system of the Crusader Citadel (headquarters of the Crusaders superhero team), character sheets with complete stats for Zed and his heroic alter-ego Zeta in VILLAINS AND VIGILANTESTM and LIVING LEGENDSTM, and a 2-page origin complete with background, tactics, personality traits, choice dialogue!

185266.name: Slash in a Flash: Fast and Furious Version of the Rules
185266.description:
From publisher blurb:

Slasher Flick -- Slash in a Flash offers a version of the Slasher Flick rules designed to be learned quickly, making it perfect for a one-off game with those who don't normally play hobby games or those who want to jump right in and get their hands bloody. Within this document, you'll find everything you need in order to run and play Slasher Flick, including character creation rules, the kill scene system and much more.

This game is designed to be printed out on a single sheet of paper or cardstock (front and back). As such, we have included a version without a background to make it easier on your printer's ink.

Note: Experienced players will find that some of the rules have been modified to make for a faster game.

185267.name: Slaughterween: A 2-Page Quick-Flick
185267.description:
From publisher blurb:

Slaughterween is a quick-flick that takes place on at a Halloween costume party. Little do the party-goers know, there's danger lurking in the darkness. 25 years ago, a "nerdy" young man was humiliated by his barely-older babysitter and her friends at a Halloween party, resulting in the boy's mind snapping. He killed or disfigured them all and has spent all these years planning his escape to make others like his tormentors pay. Upon escaping, he goes back to his old home... only to find another Halloween party going on. Let the fun (and bloodbath) commence!

This flick is designed to be printed out on a single sheet of paper or cardstock (front and back). As such, we have included a version without a background to make it easier on your printer's ink.

185268.name: Skull & Bones
rpgissuearticle: On y a joué: Skull & Bones
185268.description:
(Translated) From the publisher website

Skull & Bones is a RPG in the dark and fantastic world of world war I.

Europe is at war, dragging the world into the first planetary conflict. The situation is the work of a group of conspirators acting in the shadow from Germany, a secret society named "Skull & Bones". The conjured aim at imposing a their grip on the old continent, then all across the Earth. Their mean are way beyond the common mortals: they inherited ancestral secrets to practice a sorcery allowing them to invoke, enslave and exploits daemons !

Skull & Bones invite to play a group of adventurers fighting against Skull & Bones, the Doctors. Each Doctor has be recruited by a mentor, member of the Multitude, another occult faction, inspired by a 17th century secret brotherhood : Dog, an officer-priest of the French army, Baker, a high ranking French army officer. King, a chief in British Intelligence, Sugar, a German esoterist and Able, a Japanese diplomat posted in London.

User Summary

Not to be confused with Skull & Bones

Skull & Bones comes as a bundle of 4 32 pages booklets, a 3 pane GM screen and a map.

185269.description: Gilded Devils is an asymmetrical game of negotiation and economic conflict for 2-8 players. Set in America's Guilded Age, half the players take on the role of Industrialists, building railroads and factories in an attempt to make more money than their fellow industrialists, while the other half of the players take on the role of politicians, selling political favors to the Industrialists, and using those profits to fund their political campaigns, attempting to garner the needed votes before the competing politicians.
185269.name: Gilded Devils
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 20: TatterCon 2015!

185271.name: Contre Mission Lune Morte
185271.description:
User Summary

This short adventure for Skull & Bones, the first one ever played, takes place on the first day of the war, in Lunéville, the first city bombed by the Germans. The PCs will be introduced to the mentors and their secret brotherhood.

185272.name: Cartes des Sociétés Secrètes
185272.description:
User Summary

8 cards representing the secret societies for Skull & Bones. The art is already present in the main booklets.

Only a cosmetic accessory that don't add or help any rules.

185276.description:
Life is bustling within the castle walls. But you want for more. You want for a life in the Keep. Unfortunately, so does everyone else.

KEEP is a drafting game. Each round, players pass hands of cards consisting of items and characters. Items are worth coins on their own, or can be sold for additional coins. Characters increase the players' coins at the end of the game based on the other cards they've drafted, or offer a special ability, and sometimes both.

Each round, each player keeps and plays one card from his hand and passes the remaining cards to the next player.

Potions, Merchants, Baked Goods, and Thieves; with a combination of drafting, hidden information, and simple mechanics, choosing what to keep and what to pass may be harder than it seems.

At the end of 8 rounds, the player with the most coins can buy his way into a new life within the confines of the keep.

Featuring the illustrations of Oliver Howe, KEEP is a card game for 2-5 players set in a medieval castle, with just a hint of take that. KEEP's gameplay time is roughly 5 minutes per player.
185276.name: Keep
boardgamepodcastepisode: What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 50!!! Featuring a Patrick Hillier review of Elder Sign, AnnaBeth and her Story Cubes and Kerensa joins me again!!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 55!!! T.I.M.E Stories(Spoiler Free)

185278.description: The game consists of a deck of 53 cards. On each card is a different cat breed, belonging to one of 17 different subgroups. Each player gets five cards from the start. Each round you get to ask one player for a certain cards that you need to complete a subgroup. If the other player has the card, you get it and can ask for another card. If the other player doesn't have the requested card, you have to take a card from the draw pile and it's the next player's turn. When you have a complete subgroup, you put it on the table. When the deck runs out, you count the score.
185278.name: Kattspelet

boardgamecompilation: Machi Koro: Fabrique de jouets du Père Noël
185279.description:
An extension of Machi Koro that allows up to 6 players.

The recommended rule for this expansion is as follows:

Green : Nothing changes
Blue : Only receive money from the bank during your turn and those of your two neighbors
Red : Only receive money during your two neighbors turn
Purple : Nothing changes
It is highly encouraged to use the Marina card setup and to use 12 piles instead of 10.

Includes MGA Game Center" (Gaming Mega Store) and Fabrique de jouets du Père Noël.
185279.name: Minivilles: 5-6 Extension

185282.description:
This expansion introduces new band abilities which can be used in both standard and basic variants. Before the start of the game each player randomly takes one of the disc with a special ability and places it by his or hers band board. There is an ability depicted on the disc.

This (mini-)expansion is included in the Kickstarter edition of Thrash 'n' Roll.
185282.name: Thrash'n Roll: Stage Heroes

185283.name: Dear Mr. Hadley (the Calling Game)
185283.description:
From the Introduction:

Dear Mr. Hadley,

I believe you have been waiting for this missive for some time. I believe you are ready. Steel yourself for the secrets of the Calling Game. We pieced it together from fragments of the old scrolls and filled it ourselves as need dictated. Complete it with success, and your powers in all aspects of the Art will have multiplied tenfold. Fail and stand to lose much, if not all. I last played the Calling Game two winters ago in the south, during the Shift. The Traveller was a young boy, though one of exceptional skill, and I the Guide.

185284.name: Oath of the Brotherhood: "Sneaky" John
185284.description:
"Sneaky" John is a promo card for Oath of the Brotherhood.

It consists of 1 Follower card with the following ability:
Gain 3 VP when you invite "Sneaky" John.

185285.name: Dear Mr. Hadley (the Doll Game)
185285.description:
From the Introduction:

Dear Mr. Hadley,

I trust that you received the package I sent ahead. I am loath to part with the amulet, but you need it far more than I. As for the Doll Game, it is far too dangerous to be performed, under the best of circumstances - but as I am bound to our agreement, I have disclosed the Game in its entirety as per our prior arrangement. Until now, only myself and Ms. Wells carried knowledge of this Game, and then I alone. It was entrusted to us by Madame Charron, who claimed it to have been written in the Black Book. It is my hope that you never have need to use it.

185286.name: Dear Mr. Hadley (the Tattered King's Game)
185286.description:
From the Introduction:

Dear Mr. Hadley,

You may only play the Tattered King's Game three times. I have played it twice. It is a game of prophecy and fate. The results are far more precise than those glimpse through the Hallway or by Walking. In some ways, it is safer than the two, for it does not require entry into the Grey. Conversely, and more dangerous still, it invites entities from the Grey to our side. Through the words of the shadow court, through the Fog, you may learn of things that may yet come to pass. It is to be played at the Thinning, between the stroke of midnight and the witching hour.

185287.name: Dear Mr. Hadley (the Walking Game)
185287.description:
From the Introduction:

Dear Mr. Hadley,

I write in response to your query on the Walking Game. It is a potent pursuit, but takes much time to master, though such things matter little to one as yourself. Walking is perhaps the easiest and safest way to cross through the Fog and enter the Grey. Some men, even those ignorant of our Art may perform it by mistake. To Walk through the Fog and into the Grey is something I believe all Men were born with the ability to accomplish. Even mere beasts seem to possess the rudimentary facilities necessary to cross the threshold. The trick lies in mastering oneself. To master one's self is to master the universe, or so Moore said.

185288.description:
From the Publisher: Una Notte da Lupi is a fast game full of tension.
Each player gets a hidden role: Werewolf, Seer, a harmless Farmer or another of the odd villagers with special powers.
Werewolves try to muddy the waters while villagers try to find out their identities. Who will win?
Whatever is your role, be on the watch and don't trust to easily on what other players say!

The following roles did not exist in One Night Werewolf, but do exist in both One Night Ultimate Werewolf as well as dV Gicochi’s Una Notte da Lupi.

Troublemaker: This is almost exactly the same as in One Night Ultimate Werewolf (Una Notte da Lupi has the limitation that the switched characters are limited to the players to the left and right of the Troublemaker)

Masons: This is exactly the same as the Masons One Night Ultimate Werewolf

Miteane: This is exactly the same as the Minion in One Night Ultimate Werewolf

Sorcerer’s Apprentice: This appears to be the same as the Alpha Wolf character from One Night Ultimate Werewolf Daybreak (the translation is not very good)

Werewolf Penguin: This is exactly the same as the Tanner for One Night Ultimate Werewolf

Mortovio: This appears to be the Hunter from One Night Ultimate Werewolf (again, there are a few issues with the translation)

In addition, Una Notte da Lupi provides tokens that correspond to the roles used in the game, something that One Night Ultimate Werewolf has, and One Night Werewolf does not.
185288.name: Una Notte da Lupi

185289.name: Gang Beasts
videogamehonor: 2016 IGF Awards Excellence in Design Nominee
2016 Steam Awards Better With Friends Nominee
2016 SXSW Gamer's Voice: Best Indie Game of the Year (Multiplayer) Winner
185289.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Gang Beasts is a silly multiplayer party game with surly gelatinous characters, brutal mêlée fight sequences, and absurdly hazardous environments. Set in the fictional metropolis of Beef City
Gasp with shock and delight at the spectacle of stupid pugnacious thugs punching, kicking, and throwing their foes into unspecified hazardous machinery, flaming incinerator pits, and ginormous industrial fans

Watch in horror and amusement as gangs of saggy beasts grab, push, pull, and shove their enemies from permanently suspended building scaffolds, unattended ferris wheels, and commercial haulage trucks

Source: The Game Website.

185290.description:
With a Purpose is the next supplement book for the modular Victory By Any Means campaign system with a focus on objectives and goals. Campaigns have a tendency to focus on goals and exclude the story element. This expansion has a more granular scope, focusing on a commodore instead of a supreme commander. Instead of an open ended campaign, players are working to achieve victory points.

This is done by defining the major objectives given to the players from their central government. Additionally, players will receive high priority missions that need to be completed. Campaign Moderators will have more freedom to explore the motivations of an empire, becoming a true 5x game (eXpand, eXploit, eXterminate, eXplore, and eXplain). With A Purpose supports a number of players and team play for those players who wish to try cooperative campaign games.

Since players represent low level commanders than a typical Victory by Any Means campaign, the scope of the degree is altered. Campaign turns represent shorter periods of time and each ship and ground unit is all the more precious to pull off the work given from their central command. The area will simply have more territory to explore as these campaigns include more minor systems that may exist between all the important campaign worlds in a normal game. Players must be ever vigilant of their actions and careful to control the amount of tension in the region.
185290.name: Victory by Any Means Campaign Guide (Second Edition): With a Purpose
boardgamefamily: Victory By Any Means Campaign Series

185291.description:
Pirates of the 7 Seas: Black Friday is a unique promo card specially made for the Pirates of the 7 Seas release at Spiel 2015. Its uniqueness, apart from its limited quantity, is the combination of two cards (Curse card and Port card).

Pirates, who brought rich booty to sell, are in despair. The time for Black Friday has come and all the goods cost just 1 chest of gold for each no matter its quantity. It is somebody’s bad intent, for sure! It’s probably a trick of those whose ships are carrying just air and rats into their holds.
185291.name: Pirates of the 7 Seas: Black Friday

185292.name: Terreur sur l'Orient-Express
185292.description:
User Summary

This is the French adaptation of Horror on the Orient Express (2nd Edition) for Call of Cthulhu. Pagination and organisation differ from the original.

Available also in a deluxe edition that contains a few more goodies to hand out to players.

From London to the Bosphorus, a long investigation on the luxurious Orient-Express train to unveil a very dark conspiracy.

185294.description:
Exclusive Play Mat offered during the Kickstarter of Epic Card Game (Epic) only.

Offered as a $25 add-on. Two versions to choose from: The Angelic Protector or The Angle of Death.

Both feature the Epic game logo, art created by one of the various artists of Epic, and score trackers for both players.
185294.name: Epic Card Game: Playmat

boardgameintegration: Star Wars: Box Busters – Battle of Naboo & Battle of Hoth
Star Wars: Box Busters – Battle of Naboo & Battle of Hoth
185295.description:
From the packaging:

"Two Players face off in an epic battle of planetary conquest in the Star Wars universe. Roll the dice, blast through your opponent's defenses and capture their command center to win"

Each player needs their own Battle Cube, which is a small diorama. Each has a unique combination of abilities.

This set has the Battle of Yavin, also available as a single set. Tusken Raider Attack is exclusive to this 2-Pack.
185295.name: Star Wars: Box Busters – Tusken Raider Attack & The Battle of Yavin

185297.name: Minecraft: Story Mode - Episode 2: Assembly Required
videogamecompilation: Minecraft: Story Mode – The Complete Adventure
videogameseries: Minecraft: Story Mode – A TellTale Game Series
185297.description:
User Summary

The second episode in a five episode series.

185298.name: Minecraft: Story Mode - Episode 3: The Last Place You Look
videogamecompilation: Minecraft: Story Mode – The Complete Adventure
videogameseries: Minecraft: Story Mode – A TellTale Game Series
185298.description:
User Summary

The third episode in a five episode series.

185299.name: Minecraft: Story Mode - Episode 4: A Block and a Hard Place
videogamecompilation: Minecraft: Story Mode – The Complete Adventure
videogameseries: Minecraft: Story Mode – A TellTale Game Series
185299.description:
User Summary

The fourth episode in a five episode series.

185300.name: Minecraft: Story Mode - Episode 5: Order Up!
videogamecompilation: Minecraft: Story Mode – The Complete Adventure
videogameseries: Minecraft: Story Mode – A TellTale Game Series
185300.description:
User Summary

The final episode in a five episode series.

185302.description:
Capturing the real-world thrill and challenges of planetary exploration, XTRONAUT™: The Game of Solar System Exploration gives 2 – 4 players ages 7 and up the chance to develop space missions and explore the solar system. The game is based on real planetary missions and rocket science. It also contains elements of politics and strategy that are inspired by the real-life situations that space missions face.

How do you complete your space mission?

Each player selects a Mission Card from the deck. This card determines the player's mission – the mission destination, type of spacecraft needed, the amount of Delta-V needed to achieve the mission, the potential to obtain gravity assists, and the points earned for completing the mission. Delta-V stands for change in velocity, and as applied to space missions and this game, it means the change in velocity necessary for a spacecraft to complete a selected mission.

Game play is straightforward. On their turn each player draws a playing card, plays up to three Action Cards, trades with other players, and places components on their game board. The Action Cards add real-life issues to the game that space missions often encounter - project cancellations, audits, government shutdowns, and other exciting twists and turns.

To complete a mission you must populate your game board with the right combination of cards for mission success. Each player needs to collect the Playing Cards that give them the right spacecraft, first and second stage rockets, and matching fairings. Gravity assist and solid rocket booster cards are available to provide additional Delta-V if needed to complete the assigned mission. Once the mission is complete, the player earns the points for the mission, which varies based on the size of the spacecraft and the target, and starts work on their next mission. The first player to score 10 points wins.
185302.name: Xtronaut: The Game of Solar System Exploration
boardgamepodcastepisode: Vox Republica 141: Science Is Your Friend

rpg: The Five Star Stories: The Role-Playing Game
185303.name: The Five Star Stories: The Role-Playing Game
185303.description:
User summary:

The Five Star Stories: The Role-Playing Game is presented online in HTML format. The game is divided into nine major areas, eight of which are divided into several topical areas, as follows:


Entry: Welcome, Mamoru Nagano
Act I: Introduction, How to Role-Play, Playing Materials, Role-Playing Session, The Rules, RPG Terms
Act II: Creating a Character, Phase 1, Phase 2, Phase 3, Character Skills, Skills List, Personal, Physical, Scientific, Technical, Pilot, Military, Weapons
Act III: Hand-to-Hand Combat, Phase 1, Phase 2, Phase 3
Act IV: Psionics, Ability List, Ability Descriptions, Levels 1 through 10
Act V: Equipment & Mechanics, Clothing, Food & Rations, Utilities, Electronics, Weapons, Body Armor, Bioware, Bioware Implant List, Bioware Weapons, Bioware Equipment
Act VI: Gamemastering, Creating a Scenario
Five Star Stories World: The Prologue, The Setting, Joker Star Systems, Timeline, The Knight/Headliner, The Diver, The Fatima, Mortar Headds, FSS Glossary
Game Forms: Character Sheet


In most respects the game is a fairly typical attribute/skill RPG. Character builds are assisted by the selection of a template, which is similar to a class but not nearly as restrictive. Skills are divided into several functional areas and depend upon attributes and training. A number of skills are unique to the setting. While the "Five Star Stories World" section of the site does detail the setting to a considerable degree, the very-long-running manga series upon which the RPG is based clearly will provide much more background for interested gamers (links and resources are provided on the site).

185305.name: Track Pack 2
185305.description:
From the instructions:

To use a Track Pack, discard the Jacks and Kings from your deck (trust us, you can have plenty of fun without them!), leaving the numbered cards, aces, queens, and jokers. The numbered cards are used for Random Events—you can keep that pile separate.

The ten remaining cards are used for the Track Pack, and are easy or beneficial (Queens), challenging (Aces) or murderous (Jokers). Each time a card is drawn it is discarded; the same leg never appears twice!

Alternatively, you can roll a ten‐sided die; however, you may have to reroll duplicate results.

User summary:

This Track Pack includes random track legs for the following six courses:


Great Slut Lake - Salty Water, Gay Beaches, Deserted Wilderness
High Desert Heat - Keep your cool or you'll blow your radiator!
Park City - Granola Girls in the Summer, Ski Bunnies in the Winter
I-80 - Runs from Wendover (Nevada) to Evanston (Wyoming)
Moab - Stupid Tourists, Hippy Chicks, and Damn Bicyclers
Lake Powell - Crappy Roads, Chicks in Bikinis, Beautiful Vistas

185306.description:
Ticket to Ride: Orient Express is a mini-expansion for Ticket to Ride: Europe that consists of seven new destination tickets, with these tickets set along the line of this legendary railroad. To use them, simply shuffle them into your deck of destination tickets.

The terminals are Athena, Budapest, Constantinople, London, Munchen, Paris and Venezia.

The routes and their scores are:

Budapest to Athena (7)
Budapest to Constantinople (7)
London to Constantinople (18)
Munchen to Budapest (4)
Paris to Munchen (5)
Paris to Venezia (5)
Venezia to Constantinople (10)
185306.name: Ticket to Ride: Orient Express

185307.description: Yunnan: Dian Mu Temple is a postcard expansion for Yunnan that features a new building on one side and the rules for use of the building on the reverse side.
185307.name: Yunnan: Dian Mu Temple

185308.name: Greenland: Sea Sámi
185308.description:
An expansion for Greenland, Greenland: Sea Sámi adds one tribe to the game — the Sea Sámi — along with the possibility of playing the game with four players.

The Sea Sámi were talented boat builders, praised even by the vikings, and research shows that they hunted whale very early, probably several thousand years ago. It's likely that they visited Greenland regularly, and as a snow-adapted people (probably being the inventors of skiing) the Sámi may also have had settlements on Greenland. As a Sea Sámi, you have access to daughters who use skiing and magic drums.

185309.name: Skeleton in the Cupboard
185309.description:
Watch the skeleton bones appear as you race against the ghost to uncover hidden treasures. A haunting game of suspense for all ages. The object of the game is to collect as many treasure items as possible before the skeleton is completed in the centre of the board.

Players roll two dice (one red and one white) and move around the house collecting cards from each cupboard in the different rooms. The face down cards can be treasures of varying values or special power cards or one of the eight parts of the skeleton.

In addition to the moving their own pawn (according to the number on the red die) players also move the ghost (according to the white die). With the ghost they can attempt to steal cards from the other players!

The winner is the player with the most treasure points when all eight skeleton pieces have been fitted together.

185310.description:
A promo item card for use in all [redacted] missions.

Setup
Shuffle up to two copies of Smoke Bomb into the items deck before drawing starting items, in any [redacted] mission.
If playing with 2 or more types of promo items (more coming in the future), shuffle all copies of all such items together and randomly (and secretly) add four of these cards to the items deck.

Rules
A passive player may use a Smoke Bomb to avoid an interaction.
When the active player enters a room, the passive player may play a Smoke Bomb before an interaction can happen.
These players may not have an interaction this turn, and the active player continues playing.
Note: The Smoke Bomb can only be played in the dark if the passive player also played Night Vision Goggles.
185310.name: [redacted]: Smoke Bomb

185311.name: Shuttelcraft
185311.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible starship. The space craft introduced in this installment of the series is a fast, heavily armoured but unarmed shuttle.

The PDF contains the background of the ship, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains simple deckplans (Without scale or grid!) of the ship and images showing the ship from various directions.

boardgamecompilation: Darkest Night Promo Pack: From Distant Lands
185312.description:
The Tinker scorns traditional wisdom, determined to form his own understanding rather than rely on the teachings of others. Through constant experimentation, he gradually develops and refines his own tools, every one the first of its kind. Due to its unique origins, the Tinker's magic is not quite like any other in the world...

This package includes the Tinker, along with his power cards, plus a new event and an artifact. A must-have for all Darkest Night fans!
185312.name: Darkest Night: Tinker Promo

185313.name: Shadowmatic
videogamehonor: 2015 Apple Design Awards Best Overall Design of the Year Winner
2015 Indie Prize Most Promising "In-Development" Game Winner
185313.description:
Shadowmatic is an imagination-stirring puzzle where you rotate abstract objects in a spotlight to find recognizable silhouettes in projected shadows, relevant to the surrounding environment.

The game combines stunning visuals with relaxing and captivating gameplay. On your journey to discover the right solution you will stumble upon many unexpected and infinitely varied silhouettes.

The project is focused on delivering immersively photorealistic graphics across iOS devices, combined with gameplay that’s stimulating, challenging, and relaxing at the same time. The game features 9 rooms, each flavored with unique concept, atmosphere and music.

Main features

More than 80 levels in 10 unique environments
Gorgeous graphics
Secondary objectives
Nonlinear level progression
3D parallax view
Arcade Mode




Source: The Game Website.

185314.name: Tactical Room
185314.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a full-color, 16 inch by 20 inch, floor plan of a Tactical Room , with Hex, Square and No overlay.

The PDF includes includes the VTT (Virtual Table Top Images for online play).

“The humans near their end. Our control of this planet will be absolute!”—Alien Commander just before an explosion rocks the facility

Tactical Room is a small interior map of a science fiction hallway that leads to a tactical command and control room in the south part of the map.

Tactical Room is intended for use in near or far-future science fiction.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

War’s End: A bipedal alien race has been systematically wiping out a human colony of a fringe world. The genocide is nearly complete with the last pockets of humanity’s resistance fighting for their survival in the largest colony city.

A group of human resistance fighters have volunteered to attack the main alien base on the other side of the planet. The hope is that most of the alien warriors are fighting on the front lines, leaving their command and control lightly guarded and vulnerable to a surprise attack far from the front. Perhaps the colony is doomed and this mission is a suicide run, but if the colonists can kill the alien leaders and make taking the capital costly enough, then the aliens will be too depleted to repeat this atrocity on neighboring colonies before support from the core worlds reaches the sector to stop the alien incursion into human space.

The group can play either the human resistance fighters assaulting the facility or the alien warriors trying to defend their commanders.

185315.name: Bio Lab
185315.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a full-color, 16 inch by 20 inch, floor plan of a Bio Lab, with Hex, Square and No overlay.

The PDF includes includes the VTT (Virtual Table Top Images for online play).

“I gave it a maximum dose of tranquilizers and it’s still attacking the containment walls. I need marines NOW!”—Terrified Scientist

Bio lab is a small biological containment area with a small tropical biome in the center for monitoring and experimentation on newly found biological life on a mostly tropical world.

Bio lab is intended for use in near or far-future science fiction.

Bio lab is designed for use with our SciFi Floor Tiles.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Primal Instincts: In investigating a tropical world, humanity has come across an extremely strong, aggressive, four-armed ape-like race. Marines captured one of them alive from a brutal first encounter and sent them up to the ship by putting it into cold sleep.

Scientists studied the creature in cold sleep in the cryo room, making sedatives and tranquilizers for the creature’s biology.

To test the sedative, they had marines bring the monster to a Bio lab containment facility with a tropical biome simulating the atmosphere on the planet below. The creature was fully awakened and the scientist then injected the tranquilizers into its circulatory system. At first it seemed to have an effect, but soon the creature became very violent and attacked the containment walls, starting to shatter the glass. The scientist stabbed it with even more sedatives, but it did nothing to do the creature in its heightened, adrenaline fueled berserk state.

The scientist calls for marines to subdue but not kill the creature as it shatters the glass and rips the hoses of the containment controls. The player characters need to capture the four-armed ape-like creature a second time in the full height of its rage and try to keep the scientist alive. Making it even more dangerous is that the tropical biome on the planet is hazardous to human life if exposed for a short period of time. As the room fills with gases from the planet below, it gets harder and harder to breathe.

185316.name: Demon, Babau
185316.description:
From publisher blurb:

The classic Babau demon now for Horrors in the Night.

A sly and tricky demon that can hide for years, longer in fact that a human can live, just to make a kill. Hiding and waiting, you never know when one of these will be silently ... waiting for you ...

185317.name: ForeSight (2E)
185317.description:
From the introduction:

ForeSight is easy to learn, remember, and play...ForeSight is versatile...ForeSight keeps out of your way...ForeSight is about more than just combat...ForeSight runs lean and mean...ForeSight is definite (or at least not too vague)...ForeSight is the kind of role-playing game I want to play...This edition of ForeSight is the result of many years of play-testing and tinkering...ForeSight has one rule for resolution.

Assuming you know what a role-playing game is, in order to play ForeSight you really only need to learn one rule. It’s called resolution. A chapter of this book is devoted to this rule (don’t worry, it’s full of examples). Resolution is used when someone wants to do something (“perform a task”) and the game master (GM) doesn’t know for sure whether it’s completely impossible or incredibly easy.

The resolution rule is used to determine the outcomes of tasks.

185318.name: ForeSight Character Supplements
185318.description:
User summary:

The ForeSight site provides a number of Character Supplements to assist players. They are distributed in PDF format as four one-page files and one fourteen-page file as follows:


Character Sheet - one-page character sheet
Character Worksheet - one-page worksheet used during character creation
Character Sketches - twelve concise, pre-generated sample characters (not art), on one page
Resolution Table - one-page resolution chart, abilities (1-20) cross-referenced with Ease Factor (0.25-15) with probabilities and thresholds
Character Templates - fourteen-page document of fourteen character templates (one template per page); these templates can be used as mostly pre-generated characters or viewed as example builds

185320.name: Ch'i
185320.description:
User summary:

Ch'i is a type of supernatural force that can be optionally used in any ForeSight campaign. In many ways, Ch'i functions as an alternative Magic System. The designer notes that Ch'i tends to dominate play in any ForeSight setting that utilizes the optional rules.

Characters in a setting with Ch'i may have an additional Skill (Ch'i) and may follow one of two paths: Yin, the Bright Path, or Yang, the Reflective Path.

185321.name: ForePlay
185321.description:
User summary:

ForePlay is intended to be a "ForeSight Lite" rules set that is easy enough to be almost entirely intuitive to anyone with role-playing experience. It reduces the number of Attributes from 9 to 4, reduces the Attribute rating range, and eliminates the d100 in favor of a single d10 roll. While the ForePlay rules are simpler than the ForeSight rules, they vary in several ways that would make converting resources between them non-trivial (if still easy).

185322.name: Galaxy War 1939: Legacy of the Oros
185322.description:
From publisher blurb:

It’s 1939. You’ve been sent by the Space Operations Executive to recover a mysterious doctor, shot down behind enemy lines; only these battle lines are far from home.

On Churchill IV, the Deutschstern Reich keeps order over its new conquest with Kriegstier, vicious alien predators gene-built to root out partisans in the planet’s highlands. And something else lurks in the broken hills: An alien intelligence bent on escape!

Can you find the doctor before the Kriegstier and the Nazi Raketekommandos find you?

This is a White Star (TM) RPG Compatible Adventure for character levels 1-3.

What will you find inside? Genetically modified alien predators, Nazi rocket men, intrigue, betrayal, and the mysterious Oros -- a sleeping entity from the beginning of time that seeks new disciples in its quest for domination.

12 new monsters, 4 new ships, a new class, and the Reich's finest threats for your White Star (TM) or OSR sci-fi campaign.

185323.name: Forge: Out of Chaos Primer
185323.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Forge: Out of Chaos Primer! The following pages contain a condensed version of the Forge role-playing game complete with charts, illustrations, and examples. By reading this material you will gain a working knowledge of the game. Please remember, this is just a taste of the game’s mechanics, design elements, and style.

Forge: Out of Chaos focuses on character development. Our design team has created a system of checks and balances that affect every aspect of game play. Each step in the character creation process can be as simple or complex as your imagination allows.

185324.name: D6 Galaxie: Prologue
185324.description:
User Summary

D6 Galaxie: Prologue is the core book for G6 Galaxie.

You'll find:

the infamous D6 Intégral system,
13 playable races,
16 archetypes for PCs,
33 planets described,
2 full scenarios,
dozens of adventure hooks




Note: The second printing only differs from the first with the presence of an ISBN. Content is strictly identical otherwise.

185326.name: Bane of the Tradeways
185326.description:
From the introduction:

Times are hard in the Hillsfar countryside, especially for those of non-human ancestry. Unscrupulous merchants in league with the hated Red Plumes bleed local farmers and artisans dry. Perhaps some of those loot-laden caravans coming and going from Hillsfar could use a bit of liberation? A four-hour adventure for 1st-4th level characters.

185327.name: Herald of the Moon
185327.description:
From the introduction:

Elanil Elassidil, an elf bard of no small legacy, has put out a call for trustworthy agents. It is time, it seems, for a quietly hidden piece of elven history to become known to the world. Meira Faerenduil, lost knight of Myth Drannor, has been dis-covered, and must be brought back to civilization. A four-hour adventure for 5th-10th level characters.

185328.name: ForSats
185328.description:
User Summary

The ForSats are military units made out of convicted criminals that serve their sentence as warriors.

This supplement describes the justice system, the prison system, the ForSats and everything else surrounding, as well as rules for creating characters member of ForSats.

The book ends with a scenario introducing new recruits to a mission of assisting a unit performing a civilian evacuation on a distant planet.

185329.name: Les Immortels
185329.description:
User Summary

This supplement for D6 Galaxies introduce the explorers from the CoDeX, how they travel in cryogenic sleep.

There are two parts:

Part one is a short story introducing a team of the CoDeX, their ship and how they wake up....

Part two is a complete adventure to play in the setting of that short story.

185330.name: Dans les Confins
185330.description:
(Translated) From the publisher

The Constellations War opposing Federation and Corporation is in full swing.

On the outer rim, independent merchants, pirates and corsairs, artists in search of fame, fearless explorers, slavers or illuminated mystics try to live their life away from the Corporations or the Federation. But can on really stay away from the conflict?

Discover in this supplement a general presentation of the outer rim, with a close up on the Melkin sector as well as a detailled presentaion of five location and characters that populate them. All of this embelished by numerous ideas for adventures.

The book concludes with a scenario and a mini-campaign. Enough for your players to dive into hours and hours of gaming.

185331.name: Fruit Salad
185331.description:
In Fruit Salad, players collectively assemble a fruity dish, trying to get rid of their cards in hand or score four points first.

Cards are distributed face down evenly among all players. At the start of a round, someone rolls the two dice — one showing a number 4-8, the other showing a type of fruit — then players take turns laying cards in the center of the table, covering the card most recently played. Whenever someone thinks that the stack of cards contains at least as many of the required fruit as shown on the dice, they can slap the stack and reveal the cards. If they're correct, they keep one card face up as a point and distribute the other cards among the opponents; if incorrect, they must keep all of the cards.

While this part of the game is straightforward, some cards include minions that require you to reroll either the number or fruit die, thereby changing what you're trying to collect in the salad. Can you keep track of everything?

185332.name: L'Encyclopédie des Constellations
185332.description:
(Translated) publisher blurb

In L'Encyclopédie des Constellations, we present a series of text formatted as notices or encyclopedic articles. The subjects of these articles are various and can be about planets, corporation, people or characters. Half of these are long and developed articles, including adventure hooks to play them. The other are short and aim at giving to the D6 Galaxies universe a little touch of lived and truth about daily life.

185333.name: Arsenal de Guerre
185333.description:
(Translated) Publisher Blurb

Additional rules (missiles, space fighters combat).
Eight weapons.
Eleven ships, from hospital ships to pirate frigate and military units.
Seven inventions to kill or protect (robots, drones, communication stations).

D6 Galaxies : Arsenal de Guerre provides all you need for the most epic and varied combat scenes.

185334.name: Adventurer's Kit
185334.description:
Adventurer's Kit is a culture exploration and genuine artifact excavation game, bringing kids from ages 3-12 a true adventure experience.

For the game preparation, players first setup the world map by randomly placing landscape boards with the landscapes icon side facing up, and the adventure/treasure side facing down. Each player then draws a vehicle, which corresponds to a particular starting point on the map and a holds a special ability. After getting prepared, the adventure through the ancient four continents begins!

Each turn, a player rolls a die to determine how many steps the player can move. Upon moving on to a landscape game board, the player may flip it over to find out whether it is an adventure event or treasure. Event game boards effect players located at different continents (such as Bigfoot effects Americas and Mummies effect Africa), while treasure game boards from different locations brings treasure cards from different continents. Collect the artifacts on the way and beware of the events that may occur. At the end of the game, the winner would be the first to dig out the ultimate treasure and become the great Adventurer!

Features:

► Adventure
Tornados, UFOs, Bigfoot, Kappa, and more. Overcome all the adventure obstacles through decision making, and collect more than 50 treasures on your journey to become the true adventurer!

► Culture
From the lost empires of the four continents, comes more than 30 ancient civilization that once ruled the world, including Egypt, Greek, Maya, China, Persia, and lots more.

► Artifacts
Through a series of research and testing, we are finally ready to remake the greatest legacy of civilizations out of the EXACT material, such as Terracotta Army with 100% pottery.

185335.description:
The single print run Kickstarter gameplay exclusive expansion, Hounds of Tindalos, was offered in Richard Luongs art book Kickstarter as an addon.

"Sandy Petersen has been gracious enough to allow me to offer an Exclusive Hounds of Tindalos Expansion for Cthulhu Wars! Each 80mm miniature will come with a loyalty card designed by Sandy. Jo Brumby of Fenris Games has collaborated with me to design an amazing Sculpt showing the Hound emerging from a 90 degree angle. This will be an extremely limited run and will be a highly sought after collectors item... I hope. :)" Richard Luong

Gameplay Features:

To Acquire: Pay 2 Doom and 2 Power to acquire the monster loyalty card. Then place the Hound at one of your controlled gates.
Cost: 4 power to summon

Combat: 4

Movement: Move one unit at its normal movement cost, then teleport the Hound for a cost of "0" to any gate of his choice.

Special: Cannot be killed unless it is pained into an area without a gate or the gate in its current area is removed by a faction ability and/or spell book.
185335.name: Cthulhu Wars: Hounds of Tindalos

185336.name: Sega Pico
185336.description:
The Sega Pico, also known as Kids Computer Pico is an educational video game console by Sega. Marketed as "edutainment", the main focus of the Pico was educational video games for children between 3 and 7 years old. The Pico was released in 1993 in Japan and 1994 in North America and Europe, and later reached China. It was later succeeded by the Advanced Pico Beena, which was released in Japan in 2005. Though the Pico was sold continuously in Japan through the release of the Beena, in North America and Europe the Pico was less successful and was discontinued in early 1998, later being rereleased by Majesco.

Releases for the Pico were focused on education for children and included titles supported by licensed franchised animated characters, including Disney and Sega's own Sonic the Hedgehog series. Overall, Sega claims sales of 3.4 million Pico consoles and 11.2 million game cartridges, and over 350,000 Beena consoles and 800,000 cartridges.

Powered by the same hardware used in the Sega Genesis,[1] the physical shape of the Pico was designed to appear similar to a laptop.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sega Pico", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

185337.name: Sega Advanced Pico Beena
185337.description:
The Advanced Pico Beena, also known simply as Beena or BeenaLite, is an educational console system targeted at young children sold by Sega Toys, released in 2005 in Japan. It is the successor of the Pico, and marketed around the "learn while playing" concept.

Compared to the Pico, the Beena adds several functions. Beena can be played without a television, and supports multiplayer by a separately sold additional Magic Pen. The console also supports data saving. Play time can be limited by settings in the system. Some games for the Beena also offer adaptive difficulty, which becomes more difficult to play based on the skill level of the player. The Beena Lite, a cheaper version of the console, was released on July 17, 2008. At the time of its release, Sega estimated that 350,000 Beena consoles had been sold, and 800,000 game cartridges.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sega Pico", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

185338.name: Senkan Kyosokyoku
185338.description:
Two to four players card game for Naval Arms Race prior World War Two. Mostly card represent hull, gun, engine or other equipment based on used or planed battleships in World War Two.

The game divided to two stages. In the first stage, players design new battleships by combine of parts cards. In the second stage, the winner of design competition is fight against imagined enemy's battleship.

Winner is determined by battleship design competition and combat result.

The first edition named "Senkan Kyosokyoku"(is means Battleship Roaring Songs) had a focus only on battleship design. It was self-published as one of Yuichi Kazama's Competition series. And then, combat rule were added by re-develop.

185339.description: A promo monster given away at the game's release ; just shuffle it with the other Grimoire cards and draw 5 random Monsters at the beginning of the game, as usual.
185339.name: The Big Book of Madness: Mime promo

rpgitemversion: Zone Compendium 3: Die, Meat-Eaters, Die! PDF version
Zone Compendium 3: Die, Meat-Eaters, Die! saddle-stapled version
185340.name: Dö, Köttätare, Dö!
185340.description:
User Summary:

Dö, köttätare, dö! (Die, meat-eaters, die!), contains the zone sectors:
• Svarthands bar (Black Hand's bar)
• Sopornas mästare (Masters of trash)
• Doktor Livs ö (Doctor Liv's island)
• Den nionde klanen (The ninth clan)

As well as rules for playing mutated elks, errata and new tables for rolling dangers in the Zone.

185341.name: Blink!
185341.description:
Blink! is a Doctor Who miniatures game, written as a pre-sequel to the Doctor Who story, “Blink!” The background to the story is as follows; The Doctor and Martha Jones have been investigating the strange disappearance of a number of people which have brought them into the garden of an old abandoned house. They are then ambushed by alien monsters called “Weeping Angels”, which they must escape from.

The game is involves one player taking the role of the Doctor and Martha, the other takes control of the four Weeping Angels. The aim of the game is that the Doctor and Martha must escape from the garden to win before the Weeping Angels capture them.

The game was first published in the fanzine Ragnarok, issue 60, with instructions on miniatures and scenery required.

185342.name: Professor Nod and his Turtle Race
185342.description:
"You are racing your turtle to be the first in the Winner's Circle. Howeve, along the way, you must get special instructions from Professor Nod. He can help you win - or lose - so try to please him!"

This is a fairly basic spin-and-move game with the addition of a plastic "Professor Nod" figure which is used to allow or disallow certain actions. If a player wishes to take a shortcut, ends a turn on an opponent's space, or lands on a "Spin Again" space, that player must push a "Question Card" into the base of the Professor Nod figure. If he nods, the move is acceptable, if he shakes his head to the side the move is denied.

185343.description:
It is the late 26th century. Earth is recovering from a catastrophic explosion that exterminated the majority of the population centuries ago and made most of the surface uninhabitable due to unearthly weather conditions. The surviving humans organized along four radically different ideologies, called Paths, to rebuild the world as they see fit: Harmony, Dominance, Progress, and Salvation. Followers of the four Paths live in a fragile peace, but in almost complete isolation next to each other. Their only meeting point is the last major city on Earth, now just known as the Capital.

By powering up the mysterious Time Rifts that opened in the wake of the cataclysm, each Path is able to reach back to specific moments in their past. Doing so can greatly speed up their progress, but too much meddling may endanger the time-space continuum. But progress is more important than ever before: if the mysterious message arriving through the Time Rift is to be believed, an even more terrible cataclysm is looming on the horizon: an asteroid bearing the mysterious substance called Neutronium is heading towards Earth. Even stranger, the scientists show that the energy signature of the asteroid matches the explosion centuries ago...

Anachrony features a unique two-tiered worker placement system. To travel to the Capital or venture out to the devastated areas for resources, players need not only various Specialists (Engineers, Scientists, Administrators, and Geniuses) but also Exosuits to protect and enhance them — and both are in short supply.

The game is played in 4-7 turns, depending on the time when the looming cataclysm occurs (unless, of course, it is averted!). The elapsed turns are measured on a dynamic Timeline. By powering up the Time Rifts, players can reach back to earlier turns to supply their past "self" with resources. Each Path has a vastly different objective that rewards it with a massive amount of Victory Points when achieved. The Paths' settlements will survive the impact, but the Capital will not. Whichever Path manages to collect most points will be the new seat for the Capital, thus the most important force left on the planet...
185343.name: Anachrony
boardgamepodcastepisode: #20: Ed Marriott interview, Scoville: Labs, and Scoville on tap
#44: Anachrony six-pack review and on tap; Fugitive; Valeria Card Kingdoms; Veggie Garden
1P 103 - Burgle Bros.
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 019 – 10 Reasons to Buy a Game
Episode 105 -- The Jay Andres Project
Episode 109 -- One Apocalypse After Another
Episode 16: The one about Iron Fist and social gaming
Episode 17: The one about terraforming mystics, iconography, cults of the new
Episode 26 - The Must Play Two Player Games of 2016…as of June
Episode 27: Broom Service Review - Questions from a Hat
Episode 46 :: SaltCon Recap - The Grimm Forest Kickstarter Preview
Episode 95- RobbCon 2017
Episode Seven - Anachrony, Ave Roma, Exit: The Game
HLG 10: Meer Essen
HLG 6: Samen
Vox Republica 118: A Quarriors Qretrospective

185344.description:
In those primitive times when men and dragons were enemies, former adventurers left their original guilds to serve a dragon. They protect him from the repeated assaults of adventurers attracted by his fabulous treasure, buried in the basement of the castle. What if there were more than gold to protect?

In the tile-collection game Dragon Keeper: The Dungeon, you embody these keepers and must capture the adventurers who invade the rooms of the dungeon — yet you must remain faithful to your guild by avoiding capturing its members. Once you have repelled the assaults, you give to the dragon as a tribute a part of the adventurers you caught…

In more detail, the game contains tiles in five different colors and different values. These tiles represent the adventurers who want steal the plunder of the dragon. You are responsible for removing these adventurers from the dungeon. Each turn, you take a tile for yourself and give another tile to another player. The choice of tiles depends on the position of the dragon (as the tile must be in its line or in its column). Then the dragon is moved to the location of the tile that has just been removed. Thus, each tile decision limits the choice of the next tile to take.

At the start of the game each player receives a color that they keep secret, with this color corresponding to their original guild. Every tile of this color brings them negative points. Players stack their collected tiles by color, and at the end of the game, the tallest stack is removed. If this stack is the player's guild color, then the player must discard the next tallest stack instead. Players then sum the values of their tiles, and whoever has the most points wins.
185344.name: Dragon Keeper: The Dungeon
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 165: The Steep Reign of Capitalism

185345.name: Five by Five (2nd Ed.)
185345.description:
From the introduction:

What you hold in your hands is a toolkit. It is the foundation for a game that you will not only play ... but build yourself.

In these pages you will find a means to create characters for almost any setting or genre. Five by Five does not contain exhaustive lists of skills and powers. It doesn't need them. Its systems are designed so that players can define everything they need to know about their characters in just a few words.

You will find a clean and easy system for task resolution and combat. Uncertainty is resolved by the roll of commonly found six-sided dice. Five by Five is not a method of tactical simulation. Realism takes a back seat to quick and easy methods of conflict resolution that will not impede story telling.

Five by Five is meant to be easy, friendly, and fun.

185346.name: Bariz: La Luce che Acceca
185346.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nessuno può negare la bellezza di Bariz, la vita nelle città volanti scorre tra lussuosi palazzi, gare mozzafiato e incantevoli giardini. Politica, affari e moda sono il pane quotidiano di nobili e cittadini. E un mondo selvaggio e incontaminato si estende sotto i gravitanti...

Tutto meraviglioso vero?

Non lasciarti accecare.

Dietro la luce abbagliante c'è ben altro: intrighi dinastici, duelli mortali, complotti politici, guerre tra psionici, tribù selvagge che inf4estano la superficie, rovine perdute di razze sconosciute...

E, su tutto, la lunga ombra dell'Orda e dei suoi culti infami.

Se decidi di atterrare su Bariz porta con te un paio di occhiali speciali.
Forse così vedrai quello che si cela dietro l'insidioso splendore di questo mondo.

Forse così sopravviverai.


Translation courtesy of Google:

No one can deny the beauty of Bariz, city life flying flows between luxurious palaces, breathtaking races and lovely gardens. Politics, business and fashion are the daily bread of nobles and citizens. It's a wild world and pristine stretches under gravitating ...

All wonderful right?

Do not be blinded.

Behind the high beam it is quite different: dynastic intrigue, deadly duels, political conspiracies, wars between psionic, savage tribes that inf4estano the surface, lost ruins of unknown races ...

And, on the whole, the long shadow of the Horde and its infamous cults.

If you decide to land on Bariz bring a pair of special glasses.
Maybe then you'll see what lies behind the insidious splendor of this world.

Maybe then you'll survive.

185347.name: Divine Forces: Benten, The Golden Goddess of Good Fortune
185347.description:
From publisher blurb:

THE GOLDEN-VOICED GODDESS OF FORTUNE

Gamblers, sailors, lovers, merchants, and rogues of all stripes... all invoke the name of Benten when they seek good fortune in their lives. Good, evil, or in between, Benten welcomes all comers with open arms and a song in her heart. She makes no guarentees, but those upon whom she bestows her blessings understand why she is called the Golden Goddess of Good Luck.

Divine Forces: Benten, the Golden Goddess of Good Fortune is the first in series of products that present a full religion for inclusion in your game settings. This product includes:

Cultural details about how Benten fits into the societies where she is worshipped, including how she is portryed in works of art.
Details on Benten's personality and goals, as well as her church and hiow she is typically viewed by her worshippers.
The prestige class Priest of Benten, and three new spell domains.
Two new artifacts that Benten will lend to worshippers in need.
Statistics for Benten's avatar
Information on The Seven Golden Gods of Luck, a collection of allied gods of which Benton is a member.

185348.name: Amobaelli
185348.description:
From publisher blurb:

A master of manipulation, the Amobaelli is a large green tentacled blob of a creature that has hidden agendas and manipulates human minds to achieve whatever it is they are scheming. Living in sewers and abandoned underground caverns, you never know if one of these blasphemous creatures live beneath your city.

185349.name: Penchant for Adventure - 1
185349.description:
From publisher blurb:

Penchant for Adventure – 1 is a solo adventure for a 1st level character. This series of singular adventures center around the small town of Penchant. The area in question is home to a variety of challenges depending on the level of the PC. This adventure begins with the new PCs mentor sending them to a religious coronation that they cannot attend.
