The PC is to travel, via burro, to the Bu-San Monastery and extend salutations to the new head of the order. In this case the journey IS the adventure!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a low level solo adventurer and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

185350.description:
One Night Werewolf: Monster uses the same mechanics as One Night Werewolf but has unique roles including a Hunter, Witch, Vampire, Zombie, Hanged Man, and Wolf King.

Game play is identical to Werewolf. Each player is given an identity card, with the two remaining identity cards placed in the middle of the table. Each player looks at their role card and then closes their eyes to represent falling asleep at night. The Moderator calls out the roles in a specific order for them to take their nighttime actions.

Roles:
GJ Hunter - may hunt in the graveyard cards during the night phase. Even if the Villager team loses, it can still win if the GJ Hunter manages to hunt a werewolf card.

Zombie - During the night phase may take a card from the graveyard to use as its new body to participate in the game.

Hanged Man - Simply wishes to be hanged and doesn't belong to either the Villager or Werewolf team.

Magical Girl - May use magical skills to view other cards (Similar to Sorcerer mechanics)

Vampire - May exchange his card for another card (Similar to Phantom Thief mechanics)

Big Werewolf - With more power can remember the cards in the graveyard that it raided last night.

After all roles have had their action, players open their eyes representing waking up for the daytime phase. Players now discuss who they believe are the werewolves(or if there are any in play) and vote for a player. Player with the most votes is killed; killing a werewolf causes humans to win, killing a human causes werewolves to win.
185350.name: One Night Werewolf: Monster

185351.description:
From the packaging:

"Two Players face off in an epic battle of planetary conquest in the Star Wars universe. Roll the dice, blast through your opponent's defenses and capture their command center to win"

Each player needs their own Battle Cube, which is a small diorama. Each has a unique combination of abilities.
185351.name: Star Wars: Box Busters – Endor Attack

185352.description:
From the packaging:

"Two Players face off in an epic battle of planetary conquest in the Star Wars universe. Roll the dice, blast through your opponent's defenses and capture their command center to win"

Each player needs their own Battle Cube, which is a small diorama. Each has a unique combination of abilities.
185352.name: Star Wars: Box Busters – Battle of Hoth

185353.description:
From the packaging:

"Two Players face off in an epic battle of planetary conquest in the Star Wars universe. Roll the dice, blast through your opponent's defenses and capture their command center to win"

Each player needs their own Battle Cube, which is a small diorama. Each has a unique combination of abilities.
185353.name: Star Wars: Box Busters – Battle of Yavin

185354.description:
The letter that begins with the famous expression "Dear Boss" was received on September 1888, Thursday the 27th, by the press agency Central News Agency of London, which delivered it to Scotland Yard two days later. It was written in red and contained many macabre details that they could not be ignored. It was signed: Jack The Ripper. The horror of Whitechapel had finally a name...a name that would have badgered the district forever.

Letters from Whitechapel: Dear Boss, the first expansion for Letters from Whitechapel, will help you to enter the sordid depths atmosphere of Whitechapel: You will better know the main characters of the events of that fall and face, both with Jack and policemen, new and intriguing challenges.
185354.name: Letters from Whitechapel: Dear Boss

185355.name: Unsere blauen Jungens
185355.description: The players start at their harbor at the edge of the game board and have to reach their second harbor on the island in he center of the game board. Movement is determined by a die. When they reach one of the white cicles, they have to go around before advancing to the next circle. If a player gets on an occupied space the gets thrown back according to the game rules, if he gets on a mine he has to skip a turn and if he gets on a burning ship he has to go back to his harbor and start anew.

185356.name: In Between
185356.description:
User Summary

In Between explores the concept of grief and accepting your mortality.

185357.name: Primal Carnage: Extinction
185357.description:
User Summary

Primal Carnage: Extinction is a sequel to Primal Carnage.

185358.name: Primal Carnage: Genesis
185358.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – VAPORWARE




This game is stuck in the development limbo known as Vaporware. Few to no details have been released about about its gameplay, plot, or release date since its announcement many years ago. It may or may not be in active development, but neither has it been cancelled officially.




Primal Carnage: Genesis is an upcoming story-driven single-player first person shooter game. It is a prequel to their previous game, the multiplayer-focused Primal Carnage.

Genesis takes place in a world where dinosaurs have been brought back from extinction on a remote island. Players must fight to survive after the animals escape, and will explore a mix of tropical and man-made environments teeming with dangerous prehistoric life.

Source: Wikipedia, "Primal Carnage: Genesis", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

185359.name: F.R.E.S.C.O.
185359.description:
User summary:

F.R.E.S.C.O. provides an exceptionally minimalist rule system for gaming. Characters have seven Attributes: Force (used in combat), Agility, Constitution (also known as "Hit Points"), Intelligence, Sensibility, Reactivity, and Fascination. The first six are randomly generated with 3d6. Fascination is calculated by a formula. The rules suggest non-human characters should have racial modifiers but provides the modifiers only for an Elf, as an example. Characters then choose "a couple of special talents" which are things they can do. Examples provided are: Ambidextrous, "I can make cowboy hats", "I can drive a star ship", "I am a bridge player", and "I can stand alcohol". Characters then receive "a fair amount" of money and purchase equipment. The game does not provide a monetary system or an equipment list, so this will be up to the GM.

The game uses a single resolution mechanic, called a Simulation. The GM determines when a situation should require a check, and then determines which base Attribute is involved. The GM also establishes a Difficulty (negative for easier actions, positive for difficult actions) for the action. The player then calculates their TAF (Throw for Action, but also referred to as a FAR: Fresh Action Roll) which is their Attribute value minus 2d6 minus the Difficulty. If the result is positive the action succeeds, though rolling double-six always results in failure and a double-one always results in success.

Combat uses the same basic mechanism with the added (minor) complexity of the defender's Force also being subtracted form the roll. This results in weak (low Force) characters being essentially unable to hit except on special rolls.

Characters gain Experience Points and then spend them to increase Attributes or gain "special talents". Note that the mechanism for implementing "special talents" is never addressed. Characters sheets are provided in the rules.

185360.name: Star Fresco
185360.description:
User summary:

Star Fresco is a science fiction setting for the light-weight F.R.E.S.C.O. role-playing game. Star Fresco presents a galaxy with five civilizations (human, Kailer, Vairran, Antoid, and Quid). Generally, every species/civilization is antagonistic to every other group. The setting includes a basic technology level discussion and then some equipment that is available. The basic rules are somewhat expanded by noting types of "high tech" setting activities tie back to which attributes and by providing five race-specific "special talents".

The setting is minimal.

185361.name: The High Council of Briv
185361.description:
From the introduction:

The High Council of Briv is an adventure for 4-6 characters. The characters to be played are the members of the recently born "High Council of Briv", and they should do what the councilors would do.

This is an adventure for 1-2 sessions. Players should be allowed to ask private questions between sessions.

User summary:

The adventure is available in (original) Italian and (translated) English.

185362.name: Frigor Mortis
185362.description:
User summary:

Frigor Mortis is an Italian-language horror setting for the light-weight F.R.E.S.C.O. role-playing game. Frigor Mortis presents several types of undead, both corporeal and incorporeal, and gives game statistics for most of them. A small section also details rituals and incantations that could be used to summon the undead; these could be selected as "special talents" by characters.

The setting is minimal.

185363.description:
Santa needs your help!

Help Santa collect enough of the colorful cube-shaped fruits that magically appear on the snow and ice around his Workshop to make his famous “Ice Cube Jam!” Change the map, slide on the ice, pick up cubes and be the quickest elf to drop them off to get the biggest helping of the delicious jam!

Each player is a North Pole Elf, venturing out onto the snow and ice to collect sets of colored cubes and deliver them back at the Workshop in the center of the map. The map is a randomized grid made up of terrain cards. On a player's turn, he/she can modify the map by playing a new terrain card onto it and then move their elf pawn twice. Movement can either be a single step into the adjoining square, or a long slide across open ice, collecting ice cubes along the way.

Collect a set of 3 cubes -- 1 of each color -- and deliver it to Santa's Workshop to score. Be the first to score 2 or 3 times (depending on the number of players) to win!
185363.name: Santa's Little Helpers and the Ice Cube Jam
boardgamepodcastepisode: 12 – The Family Gamers Podcast – The “Crate-y” Holiday Season

185364.name: Caccia Grossa
185364.description:
User summary:

The first part of an Italian-language pair of adventures. Originally published in PowerKaos magazine for Advanced Dungeons & Dragons, the adventure later was converted to Middle Earth Role Playing and provided for free in HTML on the Internet.

For a group of 2-3 characters of 2nd-3rd level.

185365.name: Luoghi Oscuri
185365.description:
User summary:

The second part of an Italian-language pair of adventures. Originally published in PowerKaos magazine for Advanced Dungeons & Dragons, the adventure later was converted to Middle Earth Role Playing and provided for free in HTML on the Internet.

For a group of 2-3 characters of 2nd-3rd level.

185366.name: Cronologia Integrativa
185366.description:
User summary:

Supplementary materials for an Italian-language pair of adventures. Originally published in PowerKaos magazine for Advanced Dungeons & Dragons, the adventure later was converted to Middle Earth Role Playing and provided for free in HTML on the Internet. Includes integrated chronology (for both systems) and notes.

For a group of 2-3 characters of 2nd-3rd level.

185368.name: Naruto Shippuden Deck-building Game: Mecha-Naruto Promo
185368.description:
Oversized hero card for the Naruto Shippuden Deck-building game from Cryptozoic.

Card text:
"+1 Chakra for each filled Chakra Point.
Chakra (3): +2 Power"

Features 1 "Equipment", 1 "Starter", and 2 "Enemy" Chakra Points.

185369.name: NHL Power Play Team-Building Card Game: Henrik Sedin Promo
185369.description:
Additional oversized Captain card for use with Cryptozoic's NHL Power Play Team-building Card Game, Henrik Sedin.

Card text:
"During each of your Shots on Goal, if you play one or more Attackers, you may destroy a card in your hand or discard pile."

185370.name: Journey Over the Borderline
185370.description:
User summary:

A concise adventure for Middle Earth Role Playing for 4-5 characters of about 5th level. The adventure takes place in a small town called Nevillis where the characters seek rest and food. There, they must select a tavern and depending upon their choice, the adventure begins.

Published in (original) Italian and (translated) English.

185371.name: Kineticist Codex
185371.description:
From publisher blurb:

Living conduits of power, seeking a purpose or a target…

Want to blast your enemies, but hours of character building got you down?

Open the pages of N. Jolly’s new Kineticist Codex from Purple Duck Games to find a gallery of characters with the power to manipulate air, earth, fire, water, and the aether that surrounds it all. These diverse kineticists, whose new, exciting class comes from the new class book Occult Adventures, are arranged from levels one through twenty, with statistic blocks, gear, and backgrounds from Purple Duck’s new Lands of Porphyra Campaign Setting.

You’ll be on the road to domination of aether, air, earth fire and water with the amazing adventurers from the Kineticist Codex, new from the elemental experts at Purple Duck Games!

185372.name: Comix: the RPG
185372.description:
From the Introduction to the book: In the big city, a group of criminals led by an evil mastermind plot a bank heist to fund their latest scheme. Hidden in a secret lair across the oceans, a dark force begins his tyrannical plans to rule the world. Thousands of light years away, an alien artifact threatens the nature of existence. In hidden jungles, a group of explorers unlock the secret legacy of an ancient tribe. meanwhile, back at home,a group of junior high kids wonder how they are going to pass next week's math final.
Welcome to Comix: the RPG, a fast-paced game of comic-flavored characters and adventures. Found in books, newspapers, and digital media, comics are alive with thousands of worlds that exist for each and every person who reads them, and inspire the imaginations of thousands. In titles innumerable these comics, from newspaper strips to graphic novels to independent webcomics, provide us with drama, humor, and horror. In Comix, you will play in one of these worlds, in the skin of another person with their own hopes, dreams, and goals, creating stories and adventures to rival those of your favorite authors and artists.

185373.name: Crawl! (Issue 11 - Sep 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Fantastic Forms of Sea Ship Propulsion
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
185373.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Seafaring Issue!

The long awaited maritime issue is now available!

Features:

Naval Warfare for Ocean Crawlers
Nautical Mighty Deeds
Fantastic Forms of Sea Ship Propulsion
The Deep Elders - Deep sea servants of Dagon
Life Aboard - Ship morale and on-board events

185374.description:
Ah, the great pyramids! Full of treasures, just waiting for you! It would be so easy without the other explorers waking up the Mummies, Werewolves, and Franks, and sending them after you. But you are quick and clever, so it shouldn't be a problem, right?

Loot N Run is a subtle bluffing game in which you have to know when to take risks. On your turn, take one of these three actions:


Loot: Draw a card and keep it in front of you.
Run: Score all of your cards. You score 1 point for each treasure on it. Double your score for a type of treasure if it is present on two or more cards.
Awaken the monster guardians: Look at an opponent's cards. If you find guardians, that player loses all unscored cards and you get the bonus from the guardians!


The first player to score 35 points wins!
185374.name: Loot N Run
boardgamepodcastepisode: Loot N Run Review with the Game Boy Geek
Podcast EP12 – Événements ludiques

185375.name: Stormweavers
185375.description:
Stormweavers is a fast-paced card game that is fun, easy to learn, and extremely strategic.

A superstorm has come to the world of Joro, threatening everything in existence. Five heroes must enter the tempest, redirect its elements, and come out on top. Only one will survive.

The game can be played with 2-5 players, and takes about 45 minutes to complete. Players must collect spell cards, craft items, and betray their fellow Stormweavers in order to combat the event cards that are drawn at the beginning of each turn.

The winner is the last standing player, and is declared the “Lord of the Storm".

185376.name: Star Wars: Galactic Connexions
185376.description:
A Star Wars themed collectible disc game. Players use character discs and their Star Wars knowledge to battle for points.

Each disc has four abilities (Attack, Honor, Deceit, Intelligence) and an ability level from 0 to 5. Players can connect their disc to another on the board if their disc's ability level is higher. The player earns points equal to the ability level marks on both sides of the connection.

When playing with the Star Wars Story Connexions rules, additional points are awarded depending on the rim color of the new disc.

The player with the most points wins.

185377.name: Basic FRINGE
185377.description:
User summary:

Basic FRINGE was intended to be the complete base rules of the FRINGE system, but it was never fully completed. The game was created and tested by an online consortium. The final-state of the rules was released in PDF format as "Version 0.1".

Characters have Primary Traits (Agility, Intelligence, Stamina, Strength, Presence, and Wits) and Secondary Traits (Defense, Fatigue, Health, Passion, Size, Speed, and Will). Primary Traits range from 0-5; Secondary Traits range from 1-20. Some characters have Unique Traits (Advantages, Disadvantages, Personality Traits). Character creation may be free or may use a points pool for distribution.

Action resolution uses either an Unopposed Action Roll or an Opposed Action Roll. Unopposed Action Rolls use 1d10 + Trait + Ability (if any) - Difficulty Class. A zero or positive trait results in success. The system presents five levels of success and five levels of failure for Action Roll values of -21 to 21. Opposed Action Rolls are similar but both opponents make the roll to compare levels of success. Action Rolls "explode" on a 1 or a 10.

boardgameintegration: Exceed: Red Horizon – Gabrek & Ulrik vs. Alice & Zoey
Exceed: Red Horizon – Reese & Heidi vs. Vincent & Nehtali
Exceed: Red Horizon – Satoshi & Mei Lien vs. Baelkhor & Morathi
Exceed: Red Horizon – Gabrek & Ulrik vs. Alice & Zoey
Exceed: Red Horizon – Reese & Heidi vs. Vincent & Nehtali
Exceed: Red Horizon – Satoshi & Mei Lien vs. Baelkhor & Morathi
185378.description:
Exceed is an easy-to-learn 2 player head-to-head fighting card game. Matches take approximately 10-20 minutes, with decks that are small enough to fit in your pocket.

Exceed is broken up into "Seasons" each Season contains 16 new fighters from various franchises, packaged into 4-character boxes.

This set features 4 characters from the world of Red Horizon: Eva, Kaden, Miska, and Lily, as well as all materials you need to play.
185378.name: Exceed: Red Horizon – Eva & Kaden vs. Miska & Lily

185379.name: Truck Mechanic Simulator 2015
185379.description:
Get ready for the big ones! This stunning simulator puts you in the front seat of a serious car workshop specialized in servicing trucks. With over 100 interactive parts per truck, this highly detailed title is not for the lightweight!

7 highly detailed truck models
3 weight categories
Each truck consists of over 100 parts to replace or repair
Upgradeable workshop with individual test tracks
Enjoy and unlock multiple achievements

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgameintegration: Exceed: Red Horizon – Eva & Kaden vs. Miska & Lily
Exceed: Red Horizon – Gabrek & Ulrik vs. Alice & Zoey
Exceed: Red Horizon – Reese & Heidi vs. Vincent & Nehtali
Exceed: Red Horizon – Eva & Kaden vs. Miska & Lily
Exceed: Red Horizon – Gabrek & Ulrik vs. Alice & Zoey
Exceed: Red Horizon – Reese & Heidi vs. Vincent & Nehtali
185380.description:
Exceed is an easy-to-learn 2 player head-to-head fighting card game. Matches take approximately 10-20 minutes, with decks that are small enough to fit in your pocket.

Exceed is broken up into "Seasons" each Season contains 16 new fighters from various franchises, packaged into 4-character boxes.

This set features 4 characters from the world of Red Horizon: Satoshi, Mei Lien, Baelkhor, and Morathi, as well as all materials you need to play.
185380.name: Exceed: Red Horizon – Satoshi & Mei Lien vs. Baelkhor & Morathi

boardgameintegration: Exceed: Red Horizon – Eva & Kaden vs. Miska & Lily
Exceed: Red Horizon – Reese & Heidi vs. Vincent & Nehtali
Exceed: Red Horizon – Satoshi & Mei Lien vs. Baelkhor & Morathi
Exceed: Red Horizon – Eva & Kaden vs. Miska & Lily
Exceed: Red Horizon – Reese & Heidi vs. Vincent & Nehtali
Exceed: Red Horizon – Satoshi & Mei Lien vs. Baelkhor & Morathi
185381.description:
Exceed is an easy-to-learn 2 player head-to-head fighting card game. Matches take approximately 10-20 minutes, with decks that are small enough to fit in your pocket.

Exceed is broken up into "Seasons" each Season contains 16 new fighters from various franchises, packaged into 4-character boxes.

This set features 4 characters from the world of Red Horizon: Gabrek, Ulrik, Alice, and Zoey, as well as all materials you need to play.
185381.name: Exceed: Red Horizon – Gabrek & Ulrik vs. Alice & Zoey

185382.description:
A zombie apocalypse survivor's reputation is only as good as their kill rate. Now track every zombie kill and dismemberment, with this awesome tokens & tiles skull trackers set from Guillotine Games.

Verliere nie den Überblick darüber, wie viele Zombies du dir schon vom Hals geschafft hast! Die klassischen Erfahrungs–Zähler jetzt mit gruseligem Totenkopf.
185382.name: Zombicide: Skull Trackers

185383.description:
A point to point block game that allows gamers to refight Grant's 1864 Overland Campaign from Culpepper to Petersburg. 1 to 2 gamers can refight the entire campaign in 2 hours or under. Low unit counts, and short turns create great tension, decision making, and high player interaction.

Each game comes with a sturdy card stock map, blocks and labels, dice, short 8 page series rules, 2 page game specific rules.

May be linked with Lee's Invincibles and Jackson & Sheridan to have a map from the VA/NC line to Harrisburg PA and the Shenandoah Valley. Volume I in the Blue & Gray Campaign Series of games from Worthington Publishing.
185383.name: Grant's Gamble

185384.name: Smoke 'em Mon
185384.description:
A drinking-style game that parodies the Pokemon CCG. Each player starts with one monster in play and 4 more in hand. On your turn, you take 2 actions -- attack or play a new monster. The attacks have humorous flavor text but mechanically just do a fixed amount of damage. Better attacks can only be used after you have 'powered up' a certain number of times -- you power up once each turn by doing some out-of-game task agreed upon ahead of time (e.g. drinking or smoking). The last player with creatures still in play wins.

Description from the designer:

The trading card game that's a little bit hazy.

Smoke 'em Mon is a multiplayer battle game where the objective is to kill all your friends smokies (monsters) and become the Grand Champion Master Sensei. To "Power Up" each player is subjected to smoking, drinking or whatever other tempting tortures your friends can dream up.

Smoke 'em Mon the trading card game features the first 101 smokies known to man and can be played with 2 to 99 players. Thanks to the special "Anything Goes" game rule battles can go in any direction at any time!

185387.name: Campus
185387.description:
User Summary

This is the main rulebook for Campus, a French RPG using D6 Intégral.

(Translated) Publisher Blurb

Campus is a game that aim to be a mix of satire of teenager movies, B and Z movies, bad kung-fu movies, scary movies that make people laugh and not scare and other bad movies that used to clog the shelves of video stores. They even got doom with Internet downloads. Anyway, in Campus the principle is that "Buffy and the Vampire and performing a Chainsaw Massacre on death avenue on Independence Day" is a real scenario synopsis. Also Angelopoulos is a loser compared to Romero.

In Campus, the PCs are student at Kingley University. They will be facing all sort of enemies: Italian or Russian mobster that have fake accent, uzbek terrorists that found a nuclear warhead in a Syr-Daria submarine, thugs that hold their gun on the side to give themselves style, asian gangs Karate olympic champions and raise by shaolin monks, megalmaniacs that want to conquer the world, sects, daemon coming from "from outer-somehthing", mutli coloured entities (small-grays are large-greens), serial killers.... In short, here we take literally "the more, the merrier".

185388.name: The Monk
185388.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a largely unarmed martial artist that can shift between various fighting styles. I say "largely" because some styles don't affect your unarmed attack, meaning that you can fully benefit from them even with a weapon (and there's a pair of optional extra moves in the back that lets you treat weapons as an unarmed strike).

How the core of the class works, is you choose several fighting styles at 1st-level. You can only have one active at a time, and each gives you a different type of bonus. For example leopard is all about speed, snake lets you use your Dexterity to attack and has 1 piercing, and tiger just gets a flat damage bonus. As you level up you can expand on the bonuses that each style gives (though again, you can still only benefit from one style at a time).

To make things easier to track, there's a sheet of "style cards" for you to cut out, one for each fighting style, and a space on the character sheet to place the card. The cards list the starting benefit, plus any bonuses for advanced moves. When you have a style active, you place the card on your sheet, and when you change it, you replace the card.

There's also a small ki pool that you can use to deal a bit of extra damage, or gain a bonus when attempting various physical feats.

Of course all of this is in addition to a slew of other moves (there are twenty-eight advanced moves in total): you can hold more ki, gain additional bonuses when you defend, become tougher when you have ki, deal more damage with it, use it to reinforce your mind, and so on. In this way you can better control what kind of monk you wanna make.

If you check out the previews, you can see the entire core class plus some of the advanced moves. More than enough to to try before you buy, for at least a few levels.

This product contains five files.

Two are letter-sized character sheets that use our new character sheet layout. One has a completely blank gear section, while the other fills in the initial choices if you want to just check some boxes and start playing.

The third is a sheet of the aforementioned "style cards".

The other two are digest-sized books, one in color, the other in black and white (to make it easier to print off at home if you want). They both contain:

The monk class, complete with (again) 28 advanced moves.
New weapons, dungeon gear, and magic items, including the *Sword of the Gathering Clouds of Heaven and the Compliant *Golden-Hooped Rod (which fans of Dragonball will recognize).
The bakemono race, with an advanced move if you want to gain additional benefits while in your animal form.
The dragon master compendium class, which lets you utilize multiple styles at once.
A few extra moves that we literally couldn't fit on the sheet.
A director's cut with questions to ask yourself when rolling up a monk, alternative backgrounds, and explanations and suggestions for some of the moves.

185389.name: Bigger
185389.description:
User Summary

Bigger is the first supplement for the French RPG Campus. While the core book describe the campus, this one extends to the town of Kingley and southern California. Also it introduce new horror and fantastic themes.

It also includes two scenarios.

185390.name: CalifornicationZ
185390.description:
User Summary

CalifornicationZ, the second supplement for Campus, go further geographically by describing Nevada and introducing the organization S.T.U.P.I.D., a governmental law enforcement agency. It also describe smaller organizations and various locations to be used in game.

Also includes 2 scenarios.

185391.name: Graduation
185391.description:
User Summary

Graduation is the third and last supplement of Campus.

The first part has rules for regulated substance and addiction, for passing exams, etc.

The second part show how to use 3 movies as scenarios for Campus, as well as new NPC and other opponents.

The third part include tools for the GM.

And then 3 scenarios.

185392.description:
We Built This City is a fight between builders to develop the most valuable properties possible. Place your factories in their backyards and hope they don't build a trash dump in the middle of your developments. Remember to connect your buildings to city hall or all of your plans will go to waste!

Players place cards, developing the city block by block. Players will develop houses, offices, and factories but the neighborhood they are building in determines how valuable these are. The player with the most valuable properties, and thus the most points, at the end of the game is the winner.
185392.name: We Built This City
boardgamepodcastepisode: TRCP - Launch Episode 10

185393.name: El Macanudo
185393.description:
9 cards are drawn into the board. One player also picks a category. Every player mentally select one of the pictures in the board and write a word or phrase that describes the picture. You must write something related to the category.

Then the first player reads its word or phrase and the rest try to guess the picture that he has selected. If nobody or everybody finds the correct card, the storyteller scores 0. Otherwise the storyteller and whoever found the correct answer scores 1.

Repeat for the next player, until all the players have read their phrase. After that, you discard the 9 cards on the board a draw another 9 cards, until somebody reach the winning score.

185394.name: Les Forces des Ténèbres
185394.description:
(Translated) publisher blurb

This 144 pages supplement introduce the secrets of the Trinités universe, as well rules for the battlefields.
Les Forces des Ténèbres presents the great occult forces against which the Trinités fight: the Harpail, the Harde and the Tehôn.

The Harpail is the allie of the Snake. Initiated by Mordred, this dark knighthood whose only goal is to vanquish the Dragon.

The Harde is the maleficient brood of the millenium. She dream of a total war. She reign with terror, manipulation of the weakest and of criminal networks.

The Tehôns live hidden in the Darkness since the dawn of time. The are the Great Ancients of the Trinités universe, those that even H. P. Lovecraft saw in his nightmares.

A GM screen is included with the book.

185395.name: Expand
185395.description:
Expand is a meditative video game in which you explore a circular labyrinth that constantly twists, stretches and expands around you.

Source: The Game Website.

185396.name: Assassins
185396.description:
User summary:

Assassins is a codified rule set for Live Action Role-Play (LARP) of the classic university campus game of assassin. The rules are quite simple and the bulk of the product consists of character sheets, league tracking, and participant liability and rules-of-conduct forms. In general, players play assassin characters that all are trying to kill each other by shooting non-dangerous projectiles. Games span hours to weeks and beyond, depending upon the play styles involved.

185397.name: HFS - The High Fantasy Society LARP
rpg: HFS: The High Fantasy Society LARP
185397.description:
User summary:

The document begins with a few pages explaining the genesis and history of the High Fantasy Society, essentially a variant Society for Creative Anachronism (SCA) that implemented additional rules to support fantasy elements including magic and monsters. The HFS attempted to be a comprehensive society with combats, fairs, demonstrations, and revels.

The rules specify that players must be costumed. The Battle Game Rules focus primarily on safety and secondarily on a realistic fantasy combat mechanism that distributes wounds to actual hit locations and discusses debility accruing from certain types and locations of wounds. Characters gained "Levels" (1-6) by duration of experience and selected a "Class". Each Class, at each Level, gave certain custom abilities. Several Classes gave access to certain types of magic, implemented as a spell system. A section presents Monster Class rules. The document also includes a fairly length segment on how to construct "safe" weapons.

185398.description: Translucent gem tokens (chips) to replace the chips in the game. Available exclusively to tournament participants of Asmodee's AsmOPlay organized play program.
185398.name: Splendor: Translucent Gem Tokens

185399.name: Mexico 1970
185399.description:
From the introduction:

It's the 70's! But nobody gives a shit about bellbottoms, leisure suits, or disco. In Mexico, the only things that matter are money and family. While gang warfare amongst the lower class was in its infancy in the U.S., it was a way of life for generations down here. If you were lucky, you were a good mariachi player. Nobody likes to let a good mariachi go to waste.

In Mexico 1970, you play the part of a middle-to-lower class Mexican (or Gringo if you're unlucky). Though your purpose is to make a better life for your self, you find the better part of your time spent just surviving. Guns blaze and children die. The old west is alive in the 70's right here in Mexico, except now there are cars and better guns. Not a good mix if you’re the suburban type.

Generally, the big cities are avoided to maintain anonymity. It’s a good thing, too. The more anonymous you are - the more invisible you are.

185401.name: The Prisoner
185401.description:
Based on the cult television series

From the introduction:

Open your mail... what do you see? You see a number for your home, a number for your phone, for your social security, credit card, debt accounts, memberships… other than your family, have you ever been able to get anything from anyone based solely on a name? I challenge you to open a bank account without any numbers. No matter where you go, your sense of identity is lost in the sea of information and you become, simply, a number. There is no more individuality, only clusters of numbers.

185402.name: Rebel Times (Issue 96 - Sep 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Spartacus - A Game of Blood and Treachery
Stare, ale jare – matematyka z grami

185403.description:
Pandemic: Promo Roles is a two-card promo featuring for use with Pandemic. Each card is double-sided, meaning there are four roles included, two of which you can use in any given game.

Card 1: Epidemiologist and Operations Expert
Card 2: Generalist and Medic

The key difference with these promo characters is they lose health when cubes are added to the city they are in, or if the city they are in outbreaks. If all four health of a promo character is ever exhausted, the players lose the game. This increases the difficulty of the game.
185403.name: Pandemic: Promo Roles

185404.name: Let's Hunt
185404.description:
Shoot the largest animal and become the king of hunters in the new simulation game, Let's Hunt! Gather professional equipment, choose your favourite hunting grounds and go shooting in the woods and valleys all around the world!

Source: The Game Website.

185405.name: Game of the Visit of Santa Claus
185405.description:
Typical and simple spin and move race game. The first player, who cross all the road first, wins the game. There is "gift" cards, which players collected as they played the game.

Based on the famous poem "A Visit From St. Nicholas," first published anonymously in 1823, which inspired countless illustrations and spin-off goods for sale.

185406.name: Das Schwarze Auge Schnellstartregeln
185406.description:
User description

16-page free quickstart guide to the new (5th) rules edition of Das Schwarze Auge.

185407.name: Bumba waar is Bumba?
185407.description:
There are four figures and five cups. Hide the figures under the cups. Your opponent wil draw a card. You will need to point out the cup under whitch the figure on the card is located. If you're right you win the card. If you are wrong the card goes away. First to five cards wins.

Bumba is a popular Belgian children's TV-show.

185408.name: Eyes Like Embers
185408.description:
Publisher Blurb

A Savage Worlds One Sheet™ By Matthew Cutter for use with Deadlands: Reloaded™ or as a Western diversion
The Denver-Pacific trainyards at Elko, Nevada are legendary in the Tombstone Epitaph for their “unclaimed freight”—misrouted parcels that ended up lost in the vast, dusty warehouses. The legends are true. One of those parcels—containing four specimens of a new type of nosferatu—was originally destined for Baron LaCroix. The Agency’s been looking for it ever since…

185409.name: …Is That You?
185409.description:
Publisher Blurb

A Savage Worlds One Sheet™ By Matthew Cutter for use with Deadlands: Reloaded™ or as a Western diversion
Run this suspenseful little tale when your pistoleros pass through the Spotswood Trading Post in Roswell, New Mexico. As thunderheads bear down on the region, it’s clear not everyone is who he or she seems to be, and your posse’s stuck in the middle!n LaCroix. The Agency’s been looking for it ever since…

185410.name: Mound of Doom
185410.description:
Publisher Blurb

A Savage Worlds One Sheet™ By Matthew Cutter for use with Deadlands: Reloaded™ or as a Western diversion
When Ms. Applewood looked out the schoolhouse window she saw something that made her blood run cold. Looming tall over Coffin Nail’s mining district stood a new geological formation that hadn’t been there the day before—a mound. Worse, closer inspection
revealed it to be more anthill than rock, although few cared to guess how big the ants might be…

185411.name: Shotgun Wedding
185411.description:
Publisher Blurb

A Savage Worlds One Sheet™ By Matthew Cutter for use with Deadlands: Reloaded™ or as a Western diversion
Your horses whinny and flatten their ears. Up ahead you see a young man sprawled out on a rock next to the trail, desperately trying to find shade under a ledge and a saguaro cactus.
“Hello there, good citizens,” he says through dry, cracked lips. “Would you mind terribly if I asked you to spare a sip of water for a youth down on his luck?”
What happens next is up to your heroes!

185412.name: Strikebreakers!
185412.description:
Publisher Blurb

A Savage Worlds One Sheet™ By Matthew Cutter for use with Deadlands: Reloaded™ or as a Western diversion Christopher, a relative of one of the heroes, is a miner in Virginia City, Nevada, where he’s on strike for safer working conditions. After Chris’ best friend is murdered by Comstock ruffians, he sends a letter to one character asking for help. It’s up to the posse to hightail it to Virginia City as quick as they can!

185414.name: Stone and a Hard Place Map Pack
185414.description:
User Description

Collects all location maps published for the Stone and a Hard Place kickstarter as free pdf.

185415.name: Epic Boss Fighter
185415.description:
Earth is under threat by 10 of the most epic bosses known to mankind. And only one can stop them….his name is Blast! Help Blast upgrades his weaponry, buy force field and upgrade his character. Be ready to defend earth against these monsters and bring peace back to our world!

Source: The Game Website.

185416.name: Abyss (2012)
185416.description:
User summary

Abyss is a Thrust-type game where the player controls a small craft that must navigate through a two-dimensional cave system picking up objects, while not touching the cavern walls. The player can rotate the craft left or right and activate its thrusters.

185417.name: Cloudstone
185417.description:
In the world of Terus, amidst the billowing clouds that stretch high and far beyond the highest mountain of Gaius, are continents that swim even higher. In the darkest of times, an evil has awaken that threatens all who live there. The best Action RPG in the clouds! Build your character how you want: be a warrior, wizard, monk, or even a hybrid! Discover new lands, slay monsters, collect epic loot, and become a hero!

Source: The Game Website.

185418.name: Epic Boss Fighter 2
185418.description:
After our hero Blast conquered 10 bosses from his previous encounter, another wave of epic bosses came down to earth to cause chaos and destruction. This time these bosses doubled their numbers and are way bigger and badder! Totally unique bosses with different abilities that will force Blast to use a different upgrade system.
Upgrade suits and collect different items and help Blast become the baddest looking hero there is.
Be sure to ask a friend to help you defeat these bosses as we also have included an option to enable 2nd player to join you on defeating bosses.
Get ready for three game modes to conquer, Normal, Hard and Insane!

Source: The Game Website.

185419.name: Cyber Chaser
185419.description:
Run, jump, duck and shoot in this super addictive runner. Complete missions, unlock weapons and purchase an array of upgrades.
The game combines the exciting gameplay of Joyride Jetpack and insane old-school action of Contra. Unlimited fun is waiting for you!

Source: The Game Website.

185420.name: Tesla: War Of Currents
185420.description:
Tesla vs Edison, keep your team alive and blast your way through each level. Upgrade your squad, unlock hidden units, and take Edison’s inventions down!

Source: The Game Website.

185421.name: Sentry Knight Conquest
185421.description:
Take control of The Marksman and blast through hordes of enemies with your trusty gun in this new adventure set in the Sentry Knight universe. Upgrade your character, unlock both familiar and new spells, tame new pets, and journey through 3 unique areas packed with enemies, bosses, quests and more in this spin-off sequel to the Sentry Knight series.

Source: The Game Website.

185422.name: Angry Gran Run
185422.description:
The smash hit mobile game is now available online! Angry Gran has been locked away in the Angry Asylum, she’s plotting her escape, and she needs YOU to guide her through the streets once she’s busted out!

Source: The Game Website.

185423.name: Aqua Boy
185423.description:
Ably assisted by a monkey sidekick and a labradoodle professor, Aqua Boy is an intrepid underwater adventurer – scouring the uncharted depths for mysterious, long-forgotten artifacts. Unfortunately, his latest mission has gone drastically wrong!

Take control of Aqua Boy as he emerges from the wreckage of his submarine, embarking on an epic adventure through the ruins of a sunken city. Meet a host of eccentric characters, from fussy bureaucrats to mercenary bees; upgrade your weapons and defences, acquiring new abilities that open up previously inaccessible areas; do battle with all kinds of strange creatures, including five bosses.

Source: The Game Website.

185424.name: World's End Chapter 1
185424.description:
Darkly comedic turn-based strategy RPG.

Learn skills to improve strength and unlock special attacks and abilities. Buy, find and plunder items and equipment. Use terrain, traps, obstacles and even foes’ corpses to gain the tactical advantage as you lead Tevoran and Company to questionable victory.

Source: The Game Website.

185425.name: World's End Chapter 2
185425.description:
The darkly comedic strategy RPG continues. Guide Tevoran and Company and their dubious new allies against bizarre creatures and environmental hazards. Enrage and confuse your enemies, throw exploding obstacles, and roundhouse-kick your way to questionable victory.

Source: The Game Website.

185426.name: Plunder Mars
185426.description:
Help captain Hermoso become first human on Mars and plunder its riches before NASA does.

Fun launcher game with lots of upgrades, casual graphics, comical sounds and original yet very simple pogo mechanics.

Source: The Game Website.

185427.name: King's Guard
185427.description:
Join the King’s Guard in this fast-paced, hybrid defense/RTS/switcher/RPG game!

King’s Guard: A Trio of Heroes is a combined defense, RPG and switcher game. Defend the King’s castles by switching building, upgrading heroes, and strategically placing wall defenders on the castle walls! Good luck, you’ll need it.

Source: The Game Website.

185428.name: Treasures of the Mystic Sea
185428.description:
It is a journey through the Mystic Sea which will enchant you with its puzzles and mysteries.
Find the legendary treasures and get the unique rewards for feats and accomplishments.
Spend a fun time on the banks of the Mystic Sea.

Source: The Game Website.

185429.name: Adventure Story
185429.description:
Explore the world of Adventure Story while battling swarms of enemies and massive bosses, collecting new equipment, and learning magic spells.

Source: The Game Website.

185430.name: Immortal Souls: Dark Crusade
185430.description:
Comic Book RPG that blends elements of Final Fantasy, Puzzle Quest, and Bejeweled!

Source: The Game Website.

185431.name: Berzerk Ball 2
185431.description:
Let out some rage on internet geeks and smash them into oblivion! Berzerk Ball 2 is finally here. Your objective is simple; select a character, build a geek, then smash him as far as you can! It won’t be easy; he’ll insult you and make fun of you in 1337 speak as you repeatedly hit him further and further! Best of all, you can upgrade your character learn new moves, earn new weapons, and other items that increase your stats and impact the overall damage you do to your nerd!

Source: The Game Website.

185432.name: Zombie Hunter (2007)
185432.description:
Watch out for Zombies! Use inverted mouse aiming to aim your gun. Click the mouse to shoot. Last as long as you can.

Source: The Game Website.

185433.name: Zombie Hunter (2012)
185433.description:
Zombies are attacking your house. Get on to the terrace aim at zombies and shoot them up. Zombie Hunter is a wonderful RPG shooter where you are supposed to shoot at weired zoombies. You are given with only one round rifle to shoot. So load your rifle by clicking on bullet box after each round of fire. Make sure no zombie enters the house else where the game comes to an end. Move on to next level to refill the grenade.

Source: The Game Website.

185434.name: Heroes of Normandie
185434.description:
The PC adaptation of the famous board game Heroes of Normandie is out and is ready to blow your mind!

In this stunning turn based strategy game you will command small group of gallant soldiers in tough fights through dense French countryside in six distinct campaigns against the AI or another human opponent in furious multiplayer battles! Heroes of Normandie comes with multiple game modes including campaign mode, rogue campaign, skirmish and multiplayer.

Customize your Army with a wide set of units with specific equipment , deploy powerful Heroes, give your orders on the battlefield and lead your men to victory!

Source: The Publisher Website.

185435.name: Zombie Hunter (2008)
185435.description:
The lights are out! You must make it through 10 zombie infested levels searching for guns and the Exit.

you also can post your highscores when you beat the game!

Source: The Game Website.

185436.name: Zombie Hunter (2015/I)
185436.description:
Create and train your character to fight against zombies or other players and become the best player of the world!!!

Source: The Game Website.

185437.name: Zombie Hunter (2015/II)
185437.description:
Survive the endless hordes of zombies while taking them out in style with guns ablazing and a few frag grenades.

Source: The Game Website.

185438.name: Zombie Hunters online
185438.description:
Multiplayer, cooperative online zombi shooter.
Hordes of zombies, levelups, bonuses.

Source: The Game Website.

185439.name: Deadly Neighbors
185439.description:
Customize your Family, arm them with one of more than 75 different weapons, and fight other families in the neighbourhood! You can also export your family in the multiplayer mode to share with other players.

Source: The Game Website.

185441.name: Scrabble NHL Edition
185441.description:
From the back of the box:

Lace up your skates and prepare to face off for the NHL Edition of SCRABBLE. Assist yourself and score high with an exclusive NHL dictionary as you power play your way through the most action-packed SCRABBLE game ever!

In Scrabble, players draw letter-tiles to form words on the gameboard. Each word earns points based on points of the tiles, and any bonuses. A word can only be played if it uses at least one already-played tile or adds to an already-played word.

In Scrabble NHL Edition, the board looks like a hockey rink with many NHL symbols on it and a grid pattern. The double letter spaces have the NHL logo, the triple letter spaces have the Western logo, the double word spaces have the Eastern logo on it and the triple word spaces have another NHL logo.

There are also Bonus Words that are allowed that are hockey related (NHL, Wild, Pads, Net, Save, etc.) that are worth an additional 5 points.

There are also terminology and team names that are allowed as bonus words for 10 points (Kings, Senators, Hockey, Coyotes, Faceoff).

Finally there is a section of special rules : Pre-Season, Trades, Trade Deadlines, Delay In Game, Too Many Men On The Ice, Pulling the Goalie and Offsides, designed to make the game feel more like hockey.

185442.name: GabeN:  The Final Decision
185442.description:
User Summary

This is a strangely themed game that could only appeal to diehard video game fans. You play Gabe Newell, the creator of Steam and head of Valve, in the year 2096, when he is bringing out Half-Life 3, Portal 3, and Team Fortress 3. You proceed through an ordinary looking RPG world, interacting with other Valve employees as Gabe tries to discover why his computer was sabotaged.

185443.name: Tales From The Game Tavern (Issue 1 - Autumn 2015)
185443.description:
Tales From The Game Tavern
Issue #1
Autumn 2015

Halloween issue.

Cover art by Ike Horton.

185444.name: To Heart
185444.description:
The gameplay in To Heart follows a plot line which offers pre-determined scenarios with courses of interaction, and focuses on the appeal of the eight female main characters.

Source: Wikipedia, "To Heart", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

185445.name: ToHeart2
185445.description:
It was first released for the PlayStation 2 on December 28, 2004 as an all-ages title, and was followed by an adult version playable on Microsoft Windows and subsequent all-ages versions for the PlayStation Portable and PlayStation 3.

Source: Wikipedia, "To Heart 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

185446.name: To Heart 2: Dungeon Travelers
185446.description:
The game is a spin-off from Leaf's To Heart 2 franchise, and gameplay highly resembles another To Heart 2 based mini game from the Windows visual novel Manaka de Ikuno!!, titled Final Dragon Chronicle: Guilty Requiem.

Source: Wikipedia, "To Heart 2: Dungeon Travelers", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

185447.name: To Heart 2 Another Days
185447.description:
User Summary

Another Days‍ '​ plot takes place in the fall as a continuation of To Heart 2‍‍ '​‍s story, and its main storyline allows the player to pursue seven heroines consisting of both supporting female characters from To Heart 2 and new characters.

185448.name: Jotun
videogamehonor: 2015 Global Game Awards Best Indie Game of the Year Nominee
2016 CVA Best Art Direction of the Year Winner
2016 CVA Best Canadian-Made Game of the Year Nominee
2016 CVA Best Console Game of the Year Nominee
2016 CVA Best Debut Game of the Year Winner
2016 CVA Best Indie Game of the Year Nominee
185448.description:
Thora, a recently deceased Viking woman, must impress the gods by defeating them in combat so that she may enter Valhalla.

Source: Wikipedia, "Jotun(video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

185449.description: Theater of Operations: The Talion Front (ToO:TF) is the first expansion for the Theater of Operations strategic wargame. It includes a completely new strategic map that can be used along with the original ToO map or alone. The expansion also includes a new faction (allied with the Magna), the Talion Republic, and a set of enemies called Marauders that attack the other main factions. Each faction has new ships including space installations (space stations and star bases).
185449.name: Imperium Chronicles: Fleets at War – Theater of Operations: The Talion Front

185450.name: New Teams: Avalon's Ideal
185450.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not all antagonists are villains. Some are misguided heroes. A group of devoted fans to a missing superhero attempt to live up to their idol by putting on super hero costumes, taking dangerous super soldier drugs, and hitting the streets to fight crime. Too bad those illegal super soldier drugs are expensive, so they take to raiding abandoned bases so they can afford to power up. They want to do good but they can't separate the heroes from the villains.

Avalon's Ideal presents a rival team of base raiders who are trying to live up to the standards of the superhero Avalon. By giving themselves superpowers and assembling a team of devoted fans, they think they can fill the gap left by the missing hero. They are mostly untrained and have rather dogmatic views about good and evil. They could become fanatical zealots or great heroes, depending on who they meet and how they are treated.

This supplement stats out the three leaders of the team and gives an adventure seed, showing how they can be used. If you need more antagonists to throw at your players in a Base Raiders game, look no further!

185451.name: Myriad Aliens: Even Stranger Options for Role-Play Adventure
185451.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the Syndics ruled over the 10,000 Worlds, their planets of choice were the most hospitable ones. Oxygen-rich atmosphere ... moderate gravity ... carbon-based life ... all of these qualities were prized by the mysterious masters of the stars. But not every world is the same... After the fall of the Empire came the rise of the forgotten, the forsaken, and then forbidden. People of all kinds, from the modest to the formidable, from the ordinary to the extreme, from the understandable to the unknowable.

This Aliens book adds 32 new options for playing even stranger creatures in your game of MYRIAD SONG. Some of the choices are simply exotic, like the scheming Serkai or the intellectual Nuderians. Other aliens cannot survive in common environments and must rely on special equipment to interact with others, like the augmented aquatic people of the Teleost, or the ponderous, solar-powered bodies of the Kyrix. And some creatures might not even be from this universe, such as the floating crystaline race of Pherix, or the hovering, mystical Ghen’Ti.

Whatever role you choose to play, just remember that you can never judge someone by their appearance, especially not in the Myriad Worlds.

185452.name: More Whispering Homunculus
185452.description:
From publisher blurb:

More Oddities and Disturbing Bits of Whimsy Ahead!

Master Richard Pett takes us on a tour of the bizarre, the curious, and the strange in More Whispering Homunculus. Within you'll find a multitude of weird charts that provide you with strange timepieces, unusual locations for overnight camping, extraordinary pets-among so many other things! As smattering sample of topics for your perusal, master:

Fifty Treasures of the Pharaohs
One Hundred Strange Pets
A Short Summary of the Fine Art of the Recurring Villain
A New Birth: Improving Your Worthless Menial
A Salt and a Seasoning of d12 Charts




Additionally, Wolfgang Baur and Miranda Horner grant you a look at explosions and supernatural activity, respectively. And finally, you'll venture into the world of the Master with an adventure that allows players to portray hapless homunculi who seek a position. Whether you need a nugget of outlandish inspiration for your game or wish to run an odd little adventure, More Whispering Homunculus delivers!

185453.name: Hoppin' Frogs
185453.description: Race to be the first one to get all your frogs into the bucket! Kids can use the bucket as a target to flip their frogs into or they can just have the frogs race each other as they let their fingers do the flipping! Game comes with 12 frogs in four colors and a reusable bucket for easy cleanup and storage.

185454.name: Construction Machines Simulator 2016
185454.description:
If you like to destroy and build things, this one is for you! Become the boss of a construction company and demolish old houses, flatten the ground, fill foundations with concrete and build new architecture.

Source: The Developer Website.

185455.name: Farm Mechanic Simulator 2015
185455.description:
Be your own boss! Enjoy your new career at an authentic farm repair service with Farm Mechanic Simulator 2015. This game gives you a fascinating insight into life of a countryside mechanical facility. Prepare yourself for big adventures with big machines. It's better than reality!

• Work on many different farm machines including tractors and harvesters
• Do over 80 unique repairs such as brakes, transmission, engine, special equipment, etc.
• Interact with the owners of farm machines seeking repairs
• Order parts and materials necessary to maintain your inventory
• Keep the costs low by buying used parts to run a profitable business
• Purchase repair manuals to enable you to work better, faster and earn more money

Source: The Developer Website.

185456.description:
LEE’S INVINCIBLES: VOLUME II focuses on Lee’s 1863 Gettysburg Campaign from Fredericksburg to Harrisburg. As Lee can you do what wasn’t done and defeat the Union army leading to the capture of Washington DC and independence for the Confederacy? As Hooker or Meade can you defeat Lee and drive his army into the Potomac forcing his surrender and ending the war years early.

Each game focuses on one or two particular campaigns from the war. The maps may be joined to lay out the Civil War in the Eastern Theater with campaigns from 1861 to 1865. Each box game comes with a 22" x 17” sturdy game map, blocks, labels, series rules, campaign specific rules, battle board, and dice. The games are playable in 2 hours or under.

Also, all three games boards can be combined for additional campaigns.
185456.name: Lee's Invincibles

185457.description:
JACKSON & SHERIDAN: VOLUME III focuses on the 1862 & 1864 Shenandoah Valley Campaigns from Lynchburg to Harper’s Ferry. As Jackson can you drive the Yankee army out of your beloved valley, forcing Lincoln to draw troops from in front of Richmond? As McDowell, Fremont, and Banks can you defeat Jackson and push east to finish the Confederacy in 1862 saving thousands of lives and years of turmoil? Refight 1864 as Sheridan and Early duel from Washington to Lynchburg.

Each game focuses on one or two particular campaigns from the war. The maps may be joined to lay out the Civil War in the Eastern Theater with campaigns from 1861 to 1865. Each box game comes with a 22" x 17” sturdy game map, blocks, labels, series rules, campaign specific rules, battle board, and dice. The games are playable in 2 hours or under.

Also, all three games boards can be combined for additional campaigns.
185457.name: Jackson & Sheridan

185458.name: Street Car Game
185458.description:
Typical and simple spin and move race game. The first player, who cross all the road first, wins the game.
The box has fabulous graphics with nice patina. The box artwork is stellar with super detailed artworks of: elephant, lion conductor, hippo, leopard, rhino, ostrich, monkeys, dog and others.
The street car is marked “MONKEYVILLE and ZEBRA STREET”, “No. O 694”.

185459.description: The Android: Netrunner – Winter 2014 Tournament Kit contains alternate art versions of Plascrete Carapace and the corp ID Weyland: Building a Better World. Along with these exclusive cards, the Winter 2014 Tournament Kit also contains a custom playmat, four deck boxes featuring Weyland, a promotional poster, and an informational pamphlet.
185459.name: Android: Netrunner – Winter 2014 Tournament Kit

185460.name: Deadly Neighbors 2
185460.description:
Epic turn based battle game. Make your own family, customize their looks, build their skills, and take down all challengers in order to become the ultimate Badass Family!

Source: The Game Website.

185461.name: Demons vs Fairyland
185461.description:
In this game, we tried to put together our favorite features in the TDs we love (Cursed Treasure, Kingdom Rush, Gemcraft…) as well as some ideas of our own. We hope you’ll enjoy it !

The people of Fairyland are after you. Fight your way back to the dark forest in this epic tower defense !

Raise an army of skeletons, command powerful beasts, summon zombies, manipulate your enemies, unlock 30 skills, 56 achievements, upgrade your towers with special abilities and defeat your pursuers !

Source: The Game Website.

185462.name: Swarm Defender
185462.description:
A throwback to the glory days of old-school Starcraft style tower defense! You control which towers you unlock! Defend against hundreds of enemies coming in massive waves!

20 unique towers
20 types of alien enemies
16 challenging levels
3 “infinite” modes to unlock
This was a quick game I made to teach myself some new programming techniques for the next LOTV (which I’ve been working on for months already!). I hope you enjoy it!

Source: The Game Website.

185463.name: Swarm Defender (2010)
185463.description:
defend from a army of hundreds of soldiers. cool FX, balanced gameplay.

Source: The Game Website.

185464.name: Swamp Defender (2014)
185464.description:
User Summary

185473.name: Frontier Horizons
185473.description:
User summary:

Frontier Horizons is a complete science-fiction roleplaying game with extensively developed rules. Character creation begins with the selection of race (eight are provided) which will influence subsequent choices. Characters have Ability Scores (Strength, Endurance, Toughness, Flexibility, Coordination, Speed, etc.) which can be either randomly generated or purchased using a point pool. The random method or the point pool will be influenced by race. Typical values range from 2-8 though higher scores are possible. Most characters are assumed to have cybernetic enhancements, Drawbacks, and Special Abilities. Demographics and appearance can be selected or randomly generated from tables. Similar tables are provided to support random background and history generation.

Characters select and Occupation which is somewhat like a traditional Class but less restrictive. The Occupation will grant certain skills at specified levels. Dozens of Occupations are provided. Characters also select Skills from a lengthy list. Characters gain experience and may improve Skills. A well-defined Psionic system is included, and a very well developed robotics system also is included.

Actions are resolved through either Skill Checks or Ability Checks. The checks are made against a modified Task Difficulty, which must be exceeded with 1d10 plus Ability modifier and possibly plus other modifiers. Combat is fairly complex with numerous situations considered, including: melee, ranged, grenade, underwater, and weightless. Lists of weapons and defenses are provided, separate from a quite lengthy section of equipment and vehicles. Another lengthy section details cybernetics and genetic manipulation.

Note that Appendix E includes all game tables; this appendix also was published as a standalone PDF ("Appendix E - Game Tables") document.

185497.description:
Dwarfs in Trouble is an easy and dynamic non- collectible card game. The participants play the role of dwarf treasure seekers who decided to pay a visit at a dragon’s den while the dragon was away. They managed to get inside. Unfortunately, while they were plundering the treasure, the dragon return unexpectedly. Certainly, it will not be polite towards anybody caught stealing its possessions. It is a common knowledge that dwarfs tend to be greedy and it would be considered a dishonour to simply throw away the precious stuff. For that reason you need get rid of the treasure in a clever way….

The aim of the game is to dispose of the gold completely or to have the fewest Gold coins the moment the Dragon arrives. As we know, dragons have the sixth sense that helps them localise gold and valuables. The dragon will focus on the most greedy treasure hunters. The arrival of the beast will cause such a confusion that only one dwarf will be able to escape and others will be burnt to ashes.

The cards

There are three kinds of cards in the deck:
dwarf cards- the ones you play in your round (a coin symbol),
counteraction – the ones you play to respond to other players cards’ effects (a shield icon), dragon’s card.

Each card has its own name (usually a dwarf quotation) and a graphic symbol of its effects.

The game setup

Shuffle the cards carefully. Put the Dragon card at the bottom of the Deck.

Each player collects 20 gold coins and draws 4 cards from the top of the Deck.

Place the remaining gold next to the Deck. From now on it is called the Dragon’s Treasure.

The game overview

The person who is most generous starts the game. Continue playing your turns clockwise. At the beginning of his or her turn each player draws a number of cards so they have a total of 4 cards in their hands.

In their turns the players can:

play any number of cards and resolve its effects,
discard any number of cards.




Important: the amount of gold and number of cards is known to all the players during the whole game.
185497.name: Dwarves in Trouble
boardgamepodcastepisode: The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 62: Wednesday, July 20th

185498.name: StormWinds 1.5
185498.description:
A number of new changes have been made including a restart campaign button and new challenge missions!
StormWinds 1.5 is a huge upgrade made to the original StormWinds. Although the first game did fairly well, a lot of suggestions were brought and I felt like we could do better. This then, is the result of hundreds of user comments and reviews. I think it’s a big step up, and I hope you all enjoy it!
StormWinds places the player in a steampunk setting, facing a massive invasion of airships and other flying contraptions. A blend between a tower defense game and a shooter, you must choose your defenses then use them personally to gain victory.
This game is by far Hero Interactive’s largest to date- over 10 people had a hand in the game at some stage in development. Players who make the purchase now get access to 2 new campaigns, new weapons, new enemies, a new boss, new challenge missions (as they come out), and cheat codes. In addition, when the beta of Bubble Tanks 2 is released, extra content purchasers will be invited to join in!
A big thank you to everyone who supported the game, gave great feedback, and helped to bring this better version online!

Source: The Game Website.

185500.name: StormWinds

Game typically runs fastest in IE

Good luck!
